Reviews.Title: “Hotel basic, staff excellent”
Reviews.Author: kirk9784
Reviews.Content: although this hotel is really basic, you get what you pay for and to be honest if u just want somewhere to stay thats in a good location and is reasonably clean then i would highly recommend this hotel. yes the rooms are a little small but it shouldnt cause any problems. the breakfast was fairly decent for a continental beakfast. This hotels strongest point though is the staff. firstly when we got there, we were very wary as a cab driver had just robbed us of 20 euros whereby we gave him the cash and he very quicky changed a 20 into a 5!! however we went into the hotel(an were 2 hours early for check in), we gave the guy our name and he said that our room may be ready but if not he would get someone to sort it for us straight away- which I thought was really good. all staff on reception had good english and if u had any questions about how to get to places or what buses to catch, they were very very good and even stood there talking you through it on a map. spanish steps are 5 minutes and the other sites arent far either

Reviews.Title: “Very Good location, but the hotel is old.”
Reviews.Author: Ondina30
Reviews.Content: hotel with excellent location with a very tasty breakfast, located on a terrace with a beautiful view as well. however, the hotel needs maintenance. we stayed three days with the air conditioning does not work. complain many times but nothing was done.

Reviews.Title: “parking nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Marg T
Reviews.Content: Our experience almost 2 years later was more than a disappointment. We just receieved our 2 tickets for "driving in a limited traffic area" while trying to naviagate to and from the "hotel parking" which was a public lot, many one- way streets away. The front desk attendent was unhelpful in guiding us and offered no help with getting our luggage into the lobby. We now have a bill for $210 on top of the $240 we paid for a DINGY, DATED hotel room. Afrer 10 days in Italy this was the worst! If we ever stay in Rome again it will be far, far from Hotel Concordia.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, small hotel (would give it 3 1/2 stars if I could)”
Reviews.Author: RMLD
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at Hotel Concordia, which I chose based on the reviews here. The pros: central location but quiet at night (small street between the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps), free wireless and free breakfast. My room was indeed quite small, and so was the elevator (as noted in the other reviews), but that really wasn't that much of a concern for me (I was staying by myself with a small suitcase). The one thing was a bit of a weird smell in my room (humidity, I think), so I had to open the window every time I went back to my room. Other than that, the room was clean and the staff helpful. Perhaps a bit expensive for the room, but it is Rome and you pay for location. A good pick for a place to stay if you don't need luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Itay G
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife just came back from a week in Hotel Concordia - The hotel staff was helpful and the room accommodating - nothing fancy but clean and useful, the location of the hotel is excellent and pretty much everything is within walking distance,

Reviews.Title: “Affordable price, good position”
Reviews.Author: EduardoB
Reviews.Content: The hotel is tiny, but located in a vary good place - halfway between Spagna and Barberini metro stops (e.g. halfway between Piazza di Spagna and Fontana di Trevi), at walking distance from main tourist attractions in Rome. Rooms are quite cosy, well kept and clean: the bathroom seemed recently refurbished, though it smelled a bit musty (no window). Furthermore, this hotel has the smallest elevator I've ever seen in my life :-) Besides this, the staff is very helpful and kind, available h24; breakfast is average.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: hernest85
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights in october. as other reviews have stated the rooms are small but what else would you expect from central rome. the hotle is within 10 mins walking distance of the trevi fountain, possibly 5 mins if you are a brisk walker. the spanish steps are basically around the corner from the hotel. if you are planning on a sightseeing holiday in rome i would heavily recommend this hotel. if you want a luxurious hotel then pay double and stay elsewhere. the staff were all friendly and helpful. there are a number of nice restaurants and shops in the vicinity of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location from which to Tour Roma.”
Reviews.Author: czechago
Reviews.Content: Everything is within walking distance from this hotel. Nice views from the roof terrace as well. Yes, the rooms are small, but the bed was comfy, the air conditioning worked well, breakfast was very good. On the negative side, if you need an elevator, uh, the one they have is big enough for one person and a carry on bag....maybe. But if you're fit and plan on walking around Rome, this is an excellent place to begin and end any trek. Price is good too.

Reviews.Title: “Just Awful”
Reviews.Author: poppajohn57
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 evenings in this hotel as a part of our 30th anniversary. We had three other couples with us. On the positive side - it is located conveniently between the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. On the negative side - the rooms are terrible. We had an upgraded room, as it was our anniversary. We were able to maintain one open suitcase, as the rooms were tiny. You could certainly have no guests in the room. The shower was tiny. My wife, who weighs 110 lbs, could not maneuver in the shower to shave her legs. It was like being in a pen. The service was abysmal. It was warm in Rome when we were there. Our room had no air conditioning. It was broken. We slept the first night without air - and sweated. They told us they would fix it. Of course they didn't. In fact, they said it wasn't broken...I won't bore you with the details, but let's just say that after fight upon fight, lies upon lies, they finally moved us to another room - for our final night. The most amazing thing? There was never a manager to be found- ever. I couldn't speak to the manager on the phone, and they were never there. I guarantee we won't set foot in that place again!

Reviews.Title: “Not as shown in photographs!”
Reviews.Author: ThelmaAustralia42
Reviews.Content: The roms are very tiny (about as big as a caravan!). The rooms were not large enough to even open a suitcase (other than on the bed!!) No view from windows and unable to openit as outside only a wall and vents for air conditioners and smells from nearby restaurants and hotels. On arrival, considered changing hotels as showers and bedside lights not working in room 305. (It would appear that all the rooms ending in 05 at the back of the hotel were the smallest!!) The roof top terrace no longer has the attractive shading in the photographs. On the whole, the hotel was in need of an update. However, the rooms were cleaned regularly! The lift was not for anyone suffering with claustrophobia (or on the large side!). As the object of our visit was to 'see Rome" we did not spend much time on the room except to sleep, so it was adequate. I would rate a 3* in Rome as a 2* elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating”
Reviews.Author: windsor
Reviews.Content: When we stayed in this hotel five years ago, we fell in love with it. This time, it was just ok. The room was adequate and clean, but dated, and the rooftop breakfast is still wonderful. The a/c was cranking when we arrived and the room was quite cool, but the carpeting in the common areas and stairs is getting threadbare and dirty. It's hard to beat the location, but we will stay somewhere else until we hear that Concordia has had a facelift.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: fantabulous
Reviews.Content: Let me begin with the positives... The location is fantastic (about 2-3 blocks from the Spanish Steps), many restaurant options in the vicinity, and most of Rome's amazing sites within walking distance. We essentially walked to EVERYTHING, even the Vatican (since the metro was closed one morning due to a strike). All the sites were about a 15 minute walk (aside from the Vatican, of course). Breakfast was included and had all the basics to fill up for your day ahead. We enjoyed the free internet. And the negatives... The room was extremely small. We couldn't lay both our suitcases on the ground and walk across the room. The decor is from the 60's. The bathroom was very small and the shower was virtually impossible to close (so there was water on the ground constantly). Worse of all, we had mold on the ceiling! Every single sound from the street is heard in the room. There was some sort of construction across the street and it woke up us every morning. Overall, I would recommend the area but not this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: wierna
Reviews.Content: Although many times in Rome before, first time in this hotel. Location and service is great, in fact one of the best I've experienced in Italy. Free internet a definite bonus! Rooms are small but quite adequate and quiet enough in this busy area. Location allows easy return to the hotel during the day and a walk out to many of Rome's "must see"attractions. Rooftop patio for breakfast (nice) and any-time relaxing. Definitely would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a good scrubbing”
Reviews.Author: jannycamUtah
Reviews.Content: Don't stay in this hotel unless you are fond of black mold on the walls and ceiling of your bathroom. The first room they gave us was totally unacceptable. The bathroom ceiling was almost completely covered in mold. The second room had some mold on the bathroom walls but we were too tired to think about moving at that point. The public area carpets were worn and dirty, upholstery was dirty, and there were black scuff marks on the walls. This hotel needs a really good cleaning. Having said that, the beds were comfortable, the bath towels were big and fluffy, the breakfast was nice up on the terrace, and the location is very good for the spanish steps area. If they would do some major cleaning, this hotel would not be a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “bad hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: mokarosario
Reviews.Content: i just came from rome and i lived in concordia room 301 ..WORST ROOM EVER...it was so tiny that a double bed doesnt feat there...there were two little single beds so close that u barely could turn from one side to the other without falling...our window...had no view ...all we saw was a wall...the aircondition on the bathroom was so noisyyy that it felt like there was some helicopter there...so the room was too tiny for 451 euros for 4 nights..for 2 people...the bathroom was bigger i could say than the room...well also the breakfast was on a place underground...was very poor...imagine that it didnt have any eggs!!just some creals and some bread with ham and cheese...the stuff was kind and gave us directions...thank God they spoke english cause the rest of italians dont..plus on ur check out THEY WILL ASK U TO PAY 2 EUROS PER PERSON FOR THE DAYS U STAYED THERE!! the only good was that it was like 3 min from piazza di spagna..and close to fontana di trevi...

Reviews.Title: “Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Amy014
Reviews.Content: Overall, I definately recommend this hotel! The location is perfectly situated within walking distance of many sights and a great place to crash after a long day of sightseeing. The hotel staff was quite friendly and accomodating! Our flight from the US to Rome was delayed a day due to the volcano, so we couldnt keep our first night's reservation at Concordia (Concordia was the first hotel we planned to stay at). When we got there we explained what happened and they kindly didn't charge us for that first night. Even though the trip was several months ago, I still remember that the girl who helped us every morning at breakfast was so kind and helpful! The room was clean (though dated). As other reviews already mentioned, the elevator is tiny...it's downright comical. But I was really looking forward to the rooftop breakfasts, so I was disappointed that when we were there the breakfast was in the basement instead of the rooftop.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Unikko
Reviews.Content: First I was in room 303 and it was tiny and there was the noisiest air conditiong I have ever heard. I changed to room 404 and that was a normal size room with big bathroom with window. The lift was tiny (only for one person max 250 kg), room only for a small person with small trolley. The breakfast on the rooftop terrace was a big bonus even it was very hot on July.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Nice and Great location!”
Reviews.Author: skar2381
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean with very good cleaning service with fresh towels every day (not typical Europe). It was amazing location with tons of restaurants and shopping around with the Spanish Steps and Metro stop so close. The staff was polite and helpful. I was also impressed with the nice breakfast that is included and I didn't even come when the roof was open, it was the winter and still very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs a major refurbish!!”
Reviews.Author: SueToron2
Reviews.Content: I usually rely on choosing hotels based on previous reviews. My girlfriend and I were very disappointed. This is our first major disappointment with Expedia. First impressions count greatly and this hotel is very worn down. In the front lobby, worn and stained carpeting and large sloppy couches. Elevator could fit 1 small person and maybe 1 piece of luggage. The circular stairs, again had worn stained carpeting. The rooms, the smallest I've seen. Dust balls, non functioning lights, the walls so thin that we could hear people up above us at night and in the morning. The toilet wouldn't flush for no reason at all. Breakfast area down very steep stairs in the basement. A couple of nice things to say is that the staff tried hard to fix problems, such as toilet etc. and the breakfast that was served was good and great proximity to the spanish steps and the trevi fountain. If this hotel were spruced up a bit, rip out the carpeting and the old couches and a bit of sound proofing, it would go a long way.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Lasrman
Reviews.Content: This is marginal in services for a 3 star hotel. There is a small lobby with a couch, the lift barely holds a person and a bag, there is no internet or bar. There is a small TV and refrigerator in the small room. bathrooms were clean and modern. The breakfast bar had breads, a little cheese and meat, cereal, yogurt and fruit. That being said, the location is great, it was clean, the staff was very friendly and helpful. It was very quiet. Compared to many I've been to in Rome it was a good experience and I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: flinty58
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a four day break in Rome, staying at the Hotel Concordia. My friends and I could not fault the hotel in anyway. The room was a triple room which was quite small but it was ok and the bathroom was large and very clean. We were staying on the 5th floor and because of the tiny lift we took the stairs (all 87 of them) but this did not put us off the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: PatnHel
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Rome recently, on a four night break using two hotels, the Accademia and the Concordia, some 200 metres apart, It was very interesting to see the difference. Both were for two adults, in a double room for two nights with breakfast. The Accademia was 120 Euros per night and the Concordia, 174 Euros per night. The reason for using two hotels started with both having an odd and extreme price hike for a night in the middle of a four night stay. Strangely, on different nights. Both hotels are in a great location and walking distance to everything. Anyway, the Concordia was the second of the two hotels, being the top side of the Via de Tritone and near to the Spanish steps. The reception staff were helpful and welcoming, which is more than could be said for the breakfast waitress. She seemed more interested in keeping the place tidy than service. Customers kept getting in her way a bit. The breakfast was good but nothing hot other than the toast and coffee. It was served on the roof terrace with distant views of St Peters. The room was not huge, but big enough for two with space to move around and storage. It looked out onto the street, which was, as described by other users, noisy which was expected. Our aircon worked, but did have an interesting chirping sound, which in the middle of the night sounded a little like a bird was living in there. The bathroom was small with only a shower, but the shower was powerful and hot which made up for that. The only criticism of the room really was that it was a bit tired. Bedding was clean, as were the surfaces, but the skirting boards were dusty. Picky, I know, but dust is skin and I don’t like sharing my room with the previous occupants. Very small lift as reviewed before, which unfortunately due to the door not being shut properly on other floors meant that the stairs were mostly used.

Reviews.Title: “Cleaniness hotel I have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: jazzylady110
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel with recommendations from TA. It was centrally located being in walking distance to many attractions and the metro. Solo traveling, I take recommendations seriously. Very small elevator, me and my luggage went up at different times. Great breakfast to start the day. Staff was okay. I was worried due to being AA female. I was picking up a 3 week cruise so I had a lot of luggage but wanted to see Rome first. Small rooms just like NYC. A nice, safe place to crash after a busy day sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but in a great location”
Reviews.Author: travellingdoozer
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very conveniently located between the Spanish Steps and the Trevi fountain. There were a lot of great restaurants in the area and we didn't have a bad meal any of the four nights that we stayed there. The rooms were small. We had a slightly smaller room than the friends we were traveling with but it was manageable. The shower was quite small but it was a stall shower so it was to be expected. The important thing though is that the rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable and the bathroom was clean. The AC worked great too! The elevator was tiny and barely fit one person with a bag. But still we made due to make multiple trips with our luggage and it all worked out. Otherwise, you're taking the spiral staircase up! One downfall was that the wifi was down for the four nights we were staying there but it wasn't a huge issue. The staff at the front desk was very good. The woman on the desk in the afternoon/evening made some good restaurant recommendations and gave good advice in general. Everyone spoke at least a litlte English and was able to communicate with us, which was helpful. The breakfast on the rooftop terrace was good and they kept replenishing the food as the morning went on so it didn't matter what time you got there. There were pastries and coffee and yogurt. It was lovely to sit outside and enjoy breakast. There was a view of St. Peter's from up there as well. We were happy with our stay at the hotel and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but nosiy and dirty”
Reviews.Author: jets3tter747
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located. It is close to the spanish steps. The staff is helpful and polite. They also have a decent breakfast. However, the bedding is not cleaned properly. I woke up in the middle of the night with rash all over my body. The concierge gave me new bedding immediately, but didn't improve things very much. I just returned home yesterday and ended up in the a&e. Certainly, I couldn't be 100% sure that it was the bedding. It could have been something that I ate. But nothing happened until sleeping in that bed for a few hours and the condition improved during the day but got worsen in the middle of the night. Although conveniently located, the hotel is facing a road with busy traffic. It is impossible to take a nap in the middle of the day even with all the windows shut. But between midnight and 6am, the street is quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Gogo_travel10
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed in the hotel for three nights. The staff was courteous and helpful, especially Laura and Simone who gave a lot of interesting trivia about Italian food, culture, family etc during our breakfast time. The buffet breakfast was simple but adequate. The room was clean and not too small. The bed was comfortable and we slept well without any noise issues. The bathroom was spacious to our surprise, but the shower area was the tiniest I have seen so far. We had no issues though, but elderly and overweight people will surely feel uncomfortable. The elevator is tiny, but it works and you can get your luggage up in multiple trips if you have to. Definitely better than not having one at all. The best thing about the hotel was it was very close to some of the top sights in Rome - Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Trevi fountain, Piazza Navona are all within walkable distance. The Spagna subway station is also just a block or two away. The only time we had to use the subway was to go to Vatican city, Roman Forum and Coloseum. There are quite a few restaurants around the area and it is very safe to walk back to the hotel at night. This was our first time in Rome and we loved our stay! Rome is a perfect blend of the ancient and modern. We definitely want to go back again and will recommend the hotel to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “If sleep matters to you don't book this one.”
Reviews.Author: chekhov
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Rome a lot of times. Probably over 20 times as I've been there with work a fair bit. The location of this hotel is good. And considering the location of the hotel the price is also good. But this was not a pleasant experience. On the first night I realised that the air-con wasn't working. The room temperature was over 24 degrees and it was stuffy. If you know central Rome you'll know that opening a window isn't an option if you want to sleep! Eventually I went downstairs (early hours of the morning). It was explained to me that the Italians didn't think it was hot, and that the air-con wouldn't be turned on until the 15th (a couple of weeks time). After a short discussion (which I had to do in Italian as the person downstairs at that time of morning couldn't speak much English) he decided to turn on the air-conditioning. Sadly he didn't know how, but at least he tried. The next morning the air-conditioning was working and although I had to tell them to turn it on again the next evening, it did stay on for the rest of the stay. The rooms are noisy! Very noisy! You can hear whenever a room nearby turns on it's taps, shower, or flushes a toilet. Don't expect to get too much sleep! The room was clean and nice, the bathroom was okay. Only news channels in English, but then spending much time in the hotel isn't why you go to Rome. I know Rome pretty well, so didn't need to speak to staff about public transport, where to eat or where to go. I'm sure the other reviewers are right, and that they are very good. They seemed nice enough (despite the first night minor disagreement about whether the air-con should be turned on!). Exploring Rome can be tiring. Being able to sleep at night is pretty important. Unless you are a really heavy sleeper or are comfortable wearing ear-plugs, then find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - negated by poor service, noise and surly staff.”
Reviews.Author: JacQCheshire
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on previous good reviews and the website photo gallery, but were very let down respectively by the surly staff and the fact that the facilities did not reflect what was advertised on the hotel website. The staffing problem was most evident around breakfast, which – despite being a scorching weekend in Spring – was not on the terrace as advertised, but in the dank basement. Dining facilities were tiny in comparison to the hotel capacity, so we queued for breakfast - during which the waiting staff ignored us. Both restaurant and Reception staff were constantly complaining about their working conditions and blaming colleagues, rather than attend to our polite requests that we be served food and be given the double room we had requested. Breakfast was eaten is silence, drowned out by relentless whining from the waitress whenever additional guests arrived. The food was neither fresh nor chilled, its staleness matched only by the air in our room because the advertised air-conditioning did not work. We tried opening the window, but were frequently awakened by the heavy traffic outside and church bells on the adjacent building. Rome is nonetheless my favourite European city. I have visited and stayed in many of it’s beautiful hotels and will do so many times more. But never again at this one.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, location and roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: majorthombe
Reviews.Content: This is a nice small hotel in a busy, but charming part of the city. Friendly hotel personell, and a very nice located roof terrace.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in an wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: PhantomMoon
Reviews.Content: my husband just stayed 3 nights in Rome at Hotel Concordia. we booked this hotel based on tripadvisor reviews and we were very pleased! for those travelling with big heavy bags... beware that not every area that goes up from the metro stations has escalators. you will be stuck going up/down stairs having to carry your heavy baggage. had we known we would have just taken a taxi to our hotel from the Termini station. but we managed to get there nonetheless... just my husband had some sore forearms from the baggage. we were given room 101 and it had two twin beds in it. I had forgotten to ask for a double bed in the request form on their site when making the reservation but my husband and I decided to just keep the room without asking for another. it was a very small room but we were already expecting it to be because I know most European hotel rooms aren't large like American chain hotels. although the room was very small, but we managed just fine. there is a closet to hang things and we left our large bag at the foot of the bed. if our bag wasn't so stuffed it would have fit under the bed just to save some room. the lift is teeny tiny but we had the porter bring the bags up for us and we just went up the stairs since it was only one flight. the bathroom is a good size and very very clean. the shower is on the small side, but it was just fine. the service was great.. the hotel staff are very friendly and the breakfast was very nice to have included in the room rate. it is a very simple breakfast, some bread, pastries, cheeses, jams etc... but very good. I brought my own travel iron and just ironed on the small desk in the bedroom. some people might get annoyed having to do this, especially if you have items that you have to spend time ironing with, but for our clothing I managed just fine. I am not sure if they provide iron/ironing boards at the hotel so that is why I brought my own iron. while researching areas to stay in, we had first concentrated around Termini station, but after reading info that there are shady areas there, we decided to go toward the Spanish steps. Hotel Concordia is just a short walk away from the Spanish steps, Piazza del Poppolo, and also the Trevi fountain. we took the double decker bus to the Colosseum, but on new years eve we walked from our hotel to the colloseum, and it isn't that bad of a walk.. it felt good to walk in the cool weather since we come from such a hot country. we went to the Termini station a couple of times and walked around outside and we were very glad we decided to go near the Spanish steps instead... they also give free internet access... but only in the lobby of the hotel.. we tried in our room anyways, and lucky us, the wireless worked in our room :) so that was another plus of being on the first floor. before I go--for the double decker buses... we got the one named "Panoramic Tours". the bus itself was nice, but every time we went to a stop to wait for one, we saw a couple other double decker bus at least twice in the time we stood waiting. one is one that has Rome as the name and Ciao Rome. I would pick one of those two instead of Panoramic next time. we are in Florence now but would go back to Hotel Concordia again in the future if we ever return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great advice, Very clean!”
Reviews.Author: w0rld-here-we-c0me
Reviews.Content: Old world charm with modern conveniences. This hotel was super clean. A/C worked great! Just a couple of blocks from Piazza di Spagna (Spanish steps), and Trevi Fountain in the other direction. We used the metro stop at Piazza di Spagna to get to Vatican city and Colosseum. Otherwise we walked. The best part about our experience was the advice on dining and transportation from the owner and other staff members. There is always someone at the front desk if you need anything and they speak English and Italian for the most part. Small lift for luggage, otherwise use the stairs. Simple, continental style breakfast, but good capuccinos!

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, friendly and a pleasure to stay at”
Reviews.Author: JuliaW12
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hotel Concordia for ten days in September. The room, though not huge, was scrupulously clean and pleasant. Every member of staff was friendly and helpful, from lending us umbrellas when it rained to sorting a taxi and fixing a tariff before we took it back to the airport. The manager was a charming man, genial and always joking and ready with a map on our arrival which he marked up to help us. It was a pleasure to stay in this hotel and we felt really welcome. The breakfast comprised cereal, pastries, fruit juice, tea/coffee and a selection of soft cheeses, French toast and yoghurts which, though not the English, American or German sort of breakfast in terms of sausages or sliced meats etc, was a good start to our day. I would most certainly stay at this hotel again. Two streets from the Spanish Steps and just round the corner from McDonald's which for tea dragons like me was very welcome. Tea for one euro almost on the hotel's doorstop (not to mention the cake shop three doors down)! Thank you, Concordia for giving us a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Norgirl
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome for 4 nights and chose this hotel because of all the good reviews on tripadvisor. This hotel is located near the spanish steps, so a good location. Trevi fountain is also close by. The hotel has no breakfast and no roof terrace. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are a bit small but its nice and clean. Its free internet service i the lobby. A tip for Rome is: Be careful were you eat, you can eat very good and very bad food We went to restaurants which was recommended but it was either closed or shut down:( We ate some very bad lasagna near the trevi fountain, it was cold and not good. We also ate at a place near the pantheon called: Di Rienzo, dont go here, very expensive, bad serivice and bad food, looks very good but its not. Places you should eat: On the top of the spanish steps next to the nice winebar, very good food. We ate lovely grilled seabas here. And its a beautiful view of Rome. "Hosterio Romania" is also a very good place to eat. Bring some good shoes in Rome because its a lot of walking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ccw2009
Reviews.Content: Arrived by taxi and before getting out Stefano appeared to help with bags.Nothing too much trouble and rooms ready even though we arrived well before checking in time.Reviews had mentioned rooms on the small side but everything spotless and ideal for our 3 day visit.. Breakfast on the roof terrace no longer an option although the breakfast room downstairs is not the same I have no complaints.All members of staff very helpful and will be staying here again Ideal location for many restaurants with the bonus of a small wine bar opposite the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very clean.”
Reviews.Author: LauraSWales
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a 4 day trip to Rome with my partner. We stayed at the Hotel Concordia and the location of the hotel was excellent! Ideal for seeing the sights and literally 2 minutes away from the Spanish Steps. The hotel itself was very good. The rooms are small but very clean. The rooms have a handy, reasonably priced fridge containing cold drinks however the hair dyers aren't up to much. The breakfast is very basic but ok. Staff at the hotel were very helpful. Overall, a very enjoyable stay at a hotel we would consider returning to and recomend to others for a great location!

Reviews.Title: “More than satisfied...”
Reviews.Author: ThesaintMilan
Reviews.Content: I am English, but work and live in Milan. Came here with my girlfriend and we had a fantastic holiday in Rome also thanks to the Hotel Concordia. We spent 6 days here.The Hotel amenities were functional.The things which are worth coming for are, the location,clean rooms,very friendly and accomodating staff. We came in low season so the prices were accessible. Great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: envne
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a four night stay at the Concordia Hotel. The Hotel is clean and the internal decoration is OK. We were in room 202. The hotel has 5 floors and terrace on the roof. The room is facing to the street. Although the windows have double glass for isolation passing cars in the street can be heard in the room. I read that many hotel's room in Rome have a problem of noises from the street, however the street of the Concordia is a small street and just a few cars were passing by during the night so this was not so bad. In the room we have a mini refrigerator with beverages in extra charge, a safe that is locked with a key, not by a digital combination lock, a small old TV with several channels but only one channel in English that was the CNN. We had air conditioner in the room that we could turn ON and OFF and this was helpful for us. The bathroom has a shower niche, hairdryer and clean towels. The location of the hotel is very good within waking distance to many tourist places at the north side of the city. Near by there are restaurants, McDonald, Ice cream shops and not far from the SPANGA Metro station. Breakfast was served in the basement. The tables were covered with maps helping a lot to the warm feeling in the small nice breakfast room. The breakfast is an upgraded continental breakfast in addition to the standard croissants and coffee offering yogurts, a few fruits, sausage and roll bread, however one morning at the time that we came for breakfast they were running out of croissants. The stuff was helpful. The reception desk made for me the reservation for the airport shuttle. There is no luggage room however after our check out we could leave our luggage in the small lobby. All the spaces in the hotel are very small lobby, room, bathroom, breakfast room, spiral stairway, elevator that fit for one person with a small bag, all these are a very compact. I have chosen to stay in the Concordia hotel base on reviews that I read in Trip Advisor prior my trip to Rome. I can agree that the 200 Euro per night that we paid is an expensive price with compare to many other hotels in the world or even in Italy but Rome is different in this manner, so at this location of the city and with Trip Advisor rating of #58 at the time of my reservation, I couldn't find another choice in a better price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Blue_MX5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Concordia for four nights at the end of July. Overall, the hotel was great! The A/C worked (a definite must for me, it was very hot), rooms were very clean and the staff were quite friendly. The breakfast (included) was just OK, but better than nothing. I loved the location, I think I went to the Trevi Fountain every night (only a 5 minute walk). I would definitely stay here again and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexasFrequentFlyer
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for sophisticated travelers who are familiar with European style hotels and want to stretch their dollars. The staff is friendly, Stefano in particular was extremely helpful in advising us about nearby restaurants and the nearest parking garage(very hard to find without his directions). The hotel was very clean, and the bathrooms small but very modern. The small room sizes are what I would expect from a hotel in an old building in an ancient city. The elevator was a god-send at the end of a long day on our feet! The storage space was fine and well arranged and we found it to be quiet for that part of Rome. The location near the Spanish Steps is excellent. The breakfast is in the basement, but it is well-lit and not gloomy. It is a European breakfast of pastries and yogurt, cheese and juice. If you are looking for an American style hotel, this is not your choice. This is a small, clean, well-run European style hotel with a great location and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but noisy on 2nd floor (front room)”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Steelerfan
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel by reading through the tripadvisor reviews. As stated in most reviews, the location is very convenient and the street is nice and neat. However, I realized on this trip that I prefer the other side of Via Del Corso, so if you know Roma, consider that as part of your hotel equation. The front desk staff was exceptional, very kind and considerate. Oh so friendly and professional. They wanted to make sure that we were safe, used the security box for valuables, had an address card before venturing out, knew our location on the map, etc. We felt very well taken care of. We were given a front room (facing street) on the second floor (203). The room was indeed small, but the bath was large, with lots of shelf space. The room and bath were very clean/fresh. On the second floor, not only did we hear ample street noise (is this the street of sirens and car alarms?), but we also had a tap dancer of sorts upstairs. Given that the rooms were small, we didn't know how one person could walk around so much. Luckily, we laughed about it. Also, the walls must be thin, despite the age of the hotel. At night (around 10 p.m.) we heard the t.v. from the room next door (behind/above our heads). I never thought much about a quiet location or room, but I guess I'm getting more persnickety with experience and age (especially when the dollar is weak and thus, I'm spending so much more.) The breakfast in the sunny yellow breakfast room downstairs was fine and dandy, with cappuchino and pastries, some meats and cheeses, yogurt and fruit. Service was very efficient and everything was clean and well presented. (However, this wasn't the best breakfast I've had at a boutique hotel.) Overall, we had a very nice stay, but still I'd go elsewhere next time because I'm interested in exploring more options in Roma. Suggestion: If the other reviews convince you that this is the place for you, ask when booking about a higher floor or a "back" room for less street noise. Also, we didn't mention any of this to management because with the heat and touring, we were too tired to repack and change rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: JPS57
Reviews.Content: Our family of five (Mom, Dad and three teenage daughters) enjoyed our stay at the Concordia. We had a double room (Queen bed) and a triple room (3 twin beds). Though not large, they were clean, nicely decorated and had modern bathrooms. The front desk was friendly, spoke english pretty well and was happy to give advice on restaurants, shopping and general directions on how to get various places. They arranged for taxis the morning we left. The hotel is very well located between the Spanish Steps and the Trevi fountain. The Pantheon and Piazza Navona are a15-20 minute walks. Taxis were easy to find around the block. A continental breakfast was included in their basement level breakfast room. The room itself was bright, clean and rather quaint. Breakfast included cereals, rolls, cheeses, some meats, juices and coffee/espresso/cappucino. We would recommend this hotel to couples or families who want a moderately priced (compared to Rome rates) hotel that doesn't have a lot of flash, but is clean, comfortable and well located.

Reviews.Title: “You decide”
Reviews.Author: DxF
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a fantastic spot and the most of the staff are very friendly and helpful. While the rooms are very compact, they are well designed, clean and cosy. I had a single room so really appreciated larger than normal French size bed. I can’t really fault the hotel however there are currently 3 BIG buts that would make me thinks twice about staying there again: 1.The Son-in-law who is at the reception most days. He is rude, unhelpful and has no customer facing skills. While I was trying to explain to him that there was a problem with the noise in my room due to the work being done on the roof he first lied to me to say that the work was next door and then accused me of being the only person to complain about the noise as no other quest has complained. Of course no other quest was staying on the 4th floor at the time. 2.The roof that is featured on the website is currently undergoing renovations and will not be finished for another few months. So if you are unlucky enough to have a room on the 4th floor you may expect some noise 3.Breakfast is the most measly I had in Italy. Even your daily croissant is long life and comes packed in a plastic wrap. The only fresh thing I could find were a few apples and a pitcher of milk. I like the hotel and its location and just hope that they can maybe fix a few of the other things so I can stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bonvoyage7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Concordia for 3 nights in May. Its a great hotel and I would highly recommend it., The location is excellent. Its less then 5 minutes away from the Spanish steps and the Trevi fountain. This is a very central and a great base for exploring Rome. I had a twin room with a large bathroom. The room was a good size for a European hotel room. The room had a good sized closet, safe and a small fridge. The breakfast at the hotel was quite sufficient. Good continental breakfast with a choice of pastries, yoghurt etc... The hotel staff was very pleasant and helpful. I would certainly recommend this hotel as a great place to stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location, small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: prolificliving
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Rome. We booked this hotel after a lot of searching, most of it on tripadvisor.com no less. We confirmed our reservations via phone a couple of times, and they were very nice on the phone. We arrived at our hotel and were given key to our room, and the maid took us to the room to show us how to work the safe. The hotel is on a street behind the Spanish Steps, so the location for this hotel is excellent. It's on a hillish road so it's a climb up to your room but then again, you'll be walking a lot in Rome! The only thing I would say about this room, not a negative since we managed fine and we travel very light (not even checked in luggage) the rooms are TINY!!! It can get a bit claustrophobic in there. We spent very little time in the Room. The window can open for fresh air but the street is quite noisy. The cleanliness was top notch. The closets next to each side of the bed are tiny too. Bathroom is also small too. I had to work hard to find space to place my makeup on a surface while applying! Nonetheless, we were delighted to be in Rome, the front desk staff is very nice. Breakfast is downstairs in the basement and it was so-so. I am not big on pastries so it was hard for me, but the coffee is good. The people are super nice and you can't beat the location!

Reviews.Title: “Great litte find”
Reviews.Author: L2003
Reviews.Content: Location – that’s what it’s about and this family run hotel has that. Close to all attractions, bus tours etc, we had a wonderful stay at this hotel in Nov 07. Stefano was a great help too, giving us tips on eating out and public transportation. The room was small but perfect for 3 days and was on the 4th floor with a balcony overlooking Rome. The bathroom was clean and spacious for what we needed. We would recommend this hotel again to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Well Located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UpDeDubs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights around New Year's with my wife. We paid €200 a night for a double room. Our stay was without a single hitch. It is a smallish hotel and our room was quite small too. However, it was very clean, nicely decorated and generally well run. It was very well located for all the main tourist attractions. The staff were very friendly & helpful. As is it a small hotel, there is no bar or restaurant but there is a little breakfast room and the breakfast was quite nice. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again if I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: emb73
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Concordia for 3 nights in Sep 2007. Hotel is in a great location, 5 minutes walk from the Spanish Steps and 10 minutes walk from Fontana Di Trevi. Easy walk to metro. Rooms are a small but comfortable and clean. The owner was very helpful with suggestions. I would stay at this hotel again. I really enjoyed the views of Rome epecially of the Vatican and St Peters from the roof top breakfast area area.

Reviews.Title: “Great people, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: StLMissouri2
Reviews.Content: Hotel Concordia was our first stop on our 16 day Europe vacation. Upon arrival to Rome, we discovered our bags did not make it with us ... Hotel Concordia's front desk took the time to call the baggage company to try to arrange or locate our bags. No luck - but we sure did appreciate their help!! The hotel could not have been in a better location!! Anywhere we wanted to go was in walking distance. It wasn't on a busy street but we could get to the Spanish Steps in a snap. The walk to the Vatican was about 30 minutes - but walking in the Roman Morning was wonderful and we loved it. It was such a great location for the price! The rooms were small - but come on, people, its Rome! Who wants to be in their rooms anyway? The bathroom was a great size - it fit our needs. And they even supplied a toothbrush and other toilettries - which saved us since we had no luggage. Everything was clean and not too noisy. The elevator was VERY small and we had to walk up a few steps - but we didn't mind. The front desk guys were really nice and we always stopped to talk and shoot the day. They recommended great restaurants and we were always greeted with a smile. The rooftop terrace was perfect. The breakfast hit the spot and got us through until lunch. We would take an apple and munch as we were sightseeing. The hot chocolate was delish and the staff were always helpful. We enjoyed our breakfasts. We would definitely stay at the Hotel Concordia again - it has everything you need and the location just can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: candwBoston
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room as my friends were staying at another hotel. The room was quite adequate for my needs. The hotel was clean and quite - the breakfast was fine and in what i would call the continental style and was served on an open air rooftop which was very pleasant. The price was great for the spanish steps area and I would stay here again if I was on the same budget.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: BIx
Reviews.Content: We booked a three night stay at the Concordia on the basis of Tripadvisor reviews, and it more than lived up to expectations. The location is excellent for both sightseeing and shopping, and there are metro stations very close by so you can easily reach places that aren't withing walking distance. Our room was small but thoughtfully equipped, with very good double glazing that kept out most of the street noise(essential in the centre of Rome), enough storage space, quiet but effective air conditioning and a good sized bathroom. All the staff were very helpful, pleasant and efficient. The breakfast terrace with its view over the rooftops to St Peter's was a delight; usual continental breakfast - pastries, rolls, packaged cheeses, salami, fruit and good coffee. Only drawbacks - and they were very minor by comparison with the good points - were rather thin internal walls, so some noise from surrounding rooms (but many European hotels in old buildings are much worse than this) and a less than efficient loo (Room 303). Would certainly recommend the Concordia to anyone looking for a central Rome hotel with character and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: kbez
Reviews.Content: The room was small -- typical of a 3 star hotel -- but the beds were very comfortable, everything was very clean, and the staff was very helpful and friendly. You can't beat the location for walking to all the various areas of Rome and there is a wonderful little enoteca across the street for drinks and/or dinner that is perfect for a rainy night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Louise_Ed
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at a few different hotels in Europe and the Hotel Concordia was by far our favourite one. The rooms were small, as we expected, but immaculately clean and very comfortable. The bathroom was quite large. The hotel manager was exceptionally helpful, even coming out to the street to wave us off as we hopped in our airport shuttle bus. The location is great, with a lot of great restaurants close by and the bus stop a short walk. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Concordia was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ozcouple2608
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Concordia for 3 nights in July. The hotel was brilliant, from the nice breakfast on the roof, to the great staff, to the cool and clean room, to the excellent location. The hotel manager was great, he mapped out all our must see locations, booked us cabs and recommended great places to eat. Concordia is centrally located to sites such as the Trevi fountain, Spanish steps and the Pantheon. Great designer shopping just down the street, lots of restaurants and a convenience store just down the road. You can catch the hop on, hop off bus 5 minutes down the road also. It was definately hot in July (38C) each day, so coming back to a very cool room was great. We didnt think the room was that small, you will definately get alot smaller in Paris & New York. Go to Concordia, you will not be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Very Clean!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoBilly
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on the first leg of our honeymoon and it was great! The rooms were a perfect size, not very big but perfect size. The best part of the room was how clean it was. That is the most important quality I look for in a hotel and it was very clean, the room, lobby, hallways, no complaints. Also, the man who works at the front desk was very helpful and friendly. He suggested 3 great restaurants for our 3 nights and they all turned out to be wonderful. Very nice guy, help us up with our bags, and showed us to the small elevator which is great to have after spending all day walking Rome. This Hotel is located right by the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain, it is also where all the hip, trendy stores are located. The only neg about this hotel was the street noise. We sleep with our windows open cause it was so nice out so it was quite noisy so bring earplugs and you will not hear a thing. That's what we did and we slept prefect with the plugs! Another great perk of the Hotel is the breakfest on the rooftop they serve every morning, this was gerat to start off your day and the service up there was great! Nice rooftop deck surrounded by plants, very enjoyable. I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean”
Reviews.Author: Tivoli580
Reviews.Content: As you will see by my title the two most important things for me when booking a hotel are location and cleanliness and the Concordia scores ten out of ten on both points. It was from all the previous recommendations on tripadvisor that I chose Concordia and I was not disappointed in any way. The hotel has everything around it that could be needed from banks to shops to restaurants and is within easy walking distance to many of Romes sites. We took a taxi to The Vatican and sauntered back via various places one day and went by Metro to the Colosseum another day and again walked back via The Pantheon shopping and eating along the way. The hotel has character from the delighful spiral staircase and roof terrace to the "tiny" lift. The bedrooms and bathrooms were immaculate. Our room was above the reception (third floor) and overlooked the street but at no time were we disturbed by noise.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location and - hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: luvwine203
Reviews.Content: Hotel Concordia is within walking distance of almost all of the sites. The desk clerk Stephano could not have been more helpful, and the ladies that greeted us each morning at breakfast with our caffe were incredibly gracious. Yes, the rooms are small, but immaculate, and the air conditioning kept us cool and comfortable during the heat of August! The hotel is 4 blocks from the Spanish Steps, and within 20 minutes to Piazza Navona, Pantheon, Trevi, Borghese Gallery, Hop On Hop Off bus stop. Taxi ride to Vatican was about 7 euros. Only complaint is steps. Tiny elevator starts on first floor (one floor above street level) and only goes to 4th floor. Breakfast terrace (beautiful, by the way!) is on 6th floor, so for those with difficulty climbing stairs, 18 steps between each floor was sometimes challenging. There is a safe in each room, and mini bar refrigerator with space enough for our 3 water bottles. Bancomat only a few doors away, and many gelateria and other eating places within a few blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Does it get any better”
Reviews.Author: Travelling-Troy
Reviews.Content: Steve and Alison-Chester -le-Street,County Durham,Eng We stayed here for a three day honeymoon, 23rd July 2007. The Hotel was absouletly beautiful, as in previous reviews the room was a little on the small side , but we were there to see the sites and not sit in the room watching cnn as a previous review complained about. The room was freshly decorated and very clean with mini bar,air con and a fantastic balcony. The staff couldn't have been anymore helpful and were genuinely concerned about the guests and helped every step of the way recommending local family run restraunt and provided us with a map and marked out all the sightseeing attractions. The hotel was bang in the middle of the Spanish steps and the Trevi fountain, all sights within easy walking distance. One thing I would recommend if arriving late eveing when is to get the bus 175 from the termini and the driver will tell you where to get off at.Don't try and walk it if you haven't been there before as it wil take you only a few minutes to get lost, however in the daylight it will take you slightly longer but you will still get lost , only the happy police at every corner will direct you with the aid of your hotel map. no phots posted as the rooms are exactly as the hotel website shows

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Jeff'swife
Reviews.Content: I agree with the small clean rooms previously reviewed here. I also agree with the convenience and we did walk everywhere!However no one ever mentioned Stefano, the hotel manager who runs the front desk. He is very caring and concerned to see that his guest aren't ripped off by gelato stands, cabbies, etc. I felt like I stayed with a member of the family. Usually front desk people can be so stand-offish to touristy questions. He truly cared and was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Misbee22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a two week stay in Italy. Rome was our last stop. Hotel Concordia was a nice, little hotel with great service. The location simply can't be beat. We were about two blocks from the Spanish Steps and about 4 from the Trevi Fountain. The location in and of itself makes this place a good find. Breakfast was served on the roof deck of the hotel which gives a nice view of St. Peter's in the distance. The food was basic but good. But it was the service and front desk that made us happy with our choice. We found the employees very helpful and sincere. They gave us recommendations for dinner and made reservations. They also mapped out walking routes to the main attractions of Rome from our hotel and gave us tips for going to Vatican City (go to St. Peter's by 8:30 - no line....go to the Vatican museum at 12:30 - no line....and they were right about all of that!). The rooms are small. Period. But you're in Rome and so does the size of the room really matter? The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was ok. Nothing too nice but sufficient. The AC worked very well (and it was HOT). Overall, it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: frequent-flyer21
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in early July. Like others, found the hotel to have great location, can walk almost anywhere in Rome, and very close to Trevi Fountain etc. Desk staff were extremely polite and helpful with maps, tips, taxis etc. Get a taxi from Ciampino Airport, fixed fare is 30 Euro (not 40 Euro as our driver asked us for, saying the hotel was 'outside the city walls' - nonsense!! - Stood our ground - No tip for him then....) nb Fare from Fiumicino would have been 40 Euro. Rooms small but very clean, and well sound-proofed from the outside with excellent double glazed windows. Air conditioning worked well and quietly. Only complaint would be the walls are very thin - next door folks coming back at 2am did disturb us! Overall though an excellent choice. Would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Stonetraveller
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to echo the previous reviews of the Concordia, pleasant and helpful staff, clean rooms (although on the small side, but adequate), good location, would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: RLEManchester
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with this find. Great hotel. brilliant position only a few minutes walk from Trevi fountain and Spanish steps. Staff extremely welcoming and helpful. Room though on small side was very comfortable and clean. Large bathroom with plenty of towels and all amenities. We would certainly go back there. R&D Manchester, UK

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, would recommend ...”
Reviews.Author: cmgp01
Reviews.Content: Room and bathroom were small but very clean. Breakfast terrace was nice. Elevator reached up to floor beneath us so we had to carry our luggage a flight of stairs. Staff amicable but not extremely helpful or communicative. Location very convenient to major sights and close to metro station.

Reviews.Title: “one great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: bryceTyneandWear
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fantastic find, and great situation. It is small , exceptionally friendly staff, immaculately clean and great breakfasts. Would never look for anywhere else in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: UpNorthMichigan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Concordia based on the ratings here and it was as described--fabulous location, average hotel. We were on the first floor and the rooms (2) were incredibly small. Clean, well kept, but definitely tired. The bathooms were tiny and the shower so small that if you dropped the soap, you had to climb out to pick it up! We tried to leave the windows open (wonderful weather) but the street noise was incredible complete with a jackhammer in the building across the street at 5 a.m. The staff is great, very friendly and accomodating. The breakfast area was still downstairs when we were there last week (moves up to the terrace in warm months) and the breakfasts include great coffee, juices, yogurts, rolls, meat, cheese, and lots of wrapped items. We had a nice stay but I definitely would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean little place”
Reviews.Author: MitchamboyManty
Reviews.Content: Me and the missus found the Concordia a very clean and tidy little place. The bed was comfy with fresh linen each day, and all toiletries were replenished daily. The rooms were a tad small, but we only really came back to sleep there. No bar or restaurant but plenty nearby . Breakfast was fairly modest though, lots of fiddly wrappers on cheeses and butter etc; but fresh juice tea and coffee available along with cereals and yogurt. By the last day I would have loved scrambled eggs on toast but the one thing this place has in spades is location. Plenty of good stuff within walking distance. Staff also really nice people and they had a proper no smoking room as we requested not just a smoking room with the ashtray removed and a squirt of fabreeze lingering in the air.

Reviews.Title: “Small... but perfectly formed!”
Reviews.Author: shirlsontour
Reviews.Content: We had a three night stay at this charming and perfectly-located hotel in mid-March 2007. The accommodation, breakfast and sufficiently attentive staff were all excellent for a 3-star hotel. The room in which we stayed - small but perfectly formed, with a generously sized bathroom - was spotlessly clean. Highly recommended, primarily for its location, and good value for money. Book direct with the hotel via their website for the best deal.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag at the Concordia”
Reviews.Author: NevadaGal
Reviews.Content: After reading so many good reviews on Tripadvisor, I was disappointed (to say the least!) upon getting to the Concordia. Our first experience was with the none-too-friendly front desk fellow Tony. Talk about a sour puss! Somewhere along the way our reservation had been messed up. We reserved 3 twins (which are composed of two single beds) but received 2 twins and a double (which consists of only one double bed). I showed Tony my paperwork and he showed me his. He claimed that between my making the reservation and them receiving it, Hotels.com must have made an error. He claimed to have discussed the situation with the owner and I was told they *must* honor the reservation *they* received and not the one I made, despite them absolutely acknowledging that there was an error made. The good news is that their double bed is more like a queen and it wasn’t so different from their twins as their twins are pushed together (almost functioning as a double) anyway. Not much separation while asleep regardless! I was also shocked at how small the rooms were… all three! When I say ‘small’ I actually mean not much room to even walk. However the location was amazing. The rooms were very clean. The bathrooms were variably well appointed (some were larger than others). Breakfast was wonderful. And other than sour puss Tony the staff was nice and helpful. In the end I got over my initial disappointment and grievances, and was able to have a charming time at the Concordia.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: CanSco
Reviews.Content: Our room on the second floor over the street was modern, well furnished, in excellent condition throughout and spotlessly clean. It was well layed out, a necessity since it was quite compact. The street noise was quite acceptable during the night and we slept well. The heater / air conditioner mounted at the ceiling was noisy and we had to turn it off (using the wall thermostat), not a problem fortunately as the outside temperature during our visit was in the mid teens. Breakfast (in the bright and attractive basement in February) provided a good variety of cold cereal, bread, fresh coffee/tea, yoghurt but only apples for fruit and one type of salami. The TV has one English channel (CNN), one in German and a couple in Italian. The staff was courteous and attentive but not very informed and/or outgoingly helpful when we asked for instance, whether it would be better to avoid the Vatican on a Sunday. The location of the hotel is really excellent for walking to many, many major tourist attractions (walking around Rome is by far the best way to see things) and the Spagna metro stop is five minutes away for the times one is in a hurry or tired. There are many places to eat or shop right close by, including a nice bar straight across the street. Bottom line, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service in this European-style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Celtlaw
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel when it was #3 on the TripAdvisor web site. It has slipped on this site for some unknown reason, but it will always be our favorite hotel in Rome. The owners-staff are friendly and very helpful. The rooms are fine, and the breakfast patio on the roof with a view of St. Peter's in the distance brightened up every morning. It's 2 blocks from the Spanish Steps (and a Metro Stop) and 3-4 blocks from the Trevi Fountain. The restaurant recommendations by the front desk were perfect. If it weren't for the grand-kids back in the States, we would have stayed here until they evicted us.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cat1984
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights last week. It was perfect. The rooms are small but immaculate and nicely furnished and the staff are lovely. The location of the hotel is it's main selling point though. It really is two minutes from the spanish steps. We realised everywhere was in walking distance, even the colloseum. It seemed that everywhere we were we realised we were within twenty minutes walk of the hotel. I will definately return to this hotel and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mank
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a visit to Rome. We stayed at the Hotel Concordia, Via Capo Le Case, 14. We had booked it on-line and were hoping it would live up to the reviews and photos we saw on-line. It did and far exceeded what we were hoping for. It is the sweetest most wonderful little hotel right in the heart of Rome. Very, very close to the Spanish Steppes and the Trevi Fountain. And we could also walk to all the other big attractions in Rome, i.e. the Colosseum. The family management team were very, very kind, helpful and friendly. The entire hotel is very clean and neat. And the rooftop terrace where breakfast is served is delightful. Also a great place for a glass of wine at the end of a day of sightseeing. We would highly recommed the hotel to anyone we know. By the way booking on-line was also very quick and smooth. Very efficient management. Gene and Pat Glade Minnesota, USA

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: glitz1995
Reviews.Content: We were there end of September 2006 and loved it. Be advised there is an element of small, but very adequate, in this hotel yet that is what makes it so charming. Every morning we opened our window and threw open our shutters to a lively Rome. Our room faced the street but the shutters muffled most of the noise and after 11 PM all was peaceful. This famiy owned hotel is immaculate, has a wonderful rooftop breakfast every morning and the staff is the best. We almost hated to go sightseeing as we had such a good time visiting with Tony, Roberto, and Stephano.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed the Concordia”
Reviews.Author: DGG2009
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Concordia because of its location and character. It is located on a fairly quiet side street between the Spanish Stairs and the Trevi Fountains. The staff was courteous and professional. The rooms were small, but clean. The continental breakfast on the roof top veranda is good. The hotel's location is fabulous. In addition to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain, there are dozens of wonderful restaurants and gelato shops nearby. The double decker tourist bus stops approximately 1 block away. We had a great time and highly recommend the Concordia.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charles2006
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in Rome in September 2006 and chose this hotel because of its location, its cost and, most importantly, the reviews it has earned. We were not disappointed. The rooms are small but comfortable and perfectly adequate. The staff are very friendly and helpful - their standard of English was excellent. The hotel is situated between the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain which means all the central sights of Rome are accessible on foot. This is not a super-plush hotel but then neither are its prices. What you get for your money is a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip to the Concordia”
Reviews.Author: Gillian_and_family
Reviews.Content: Based on recommendations from Tripadvisor, I travelled here with my 3 children in late July 2006. We had two lovely rooms, and I could not fault the hotel in any way. I even felt the owners took a paternal interest in us, giving us great advice and enhancing our trip to this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: tommo2k
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a small but adequate double room for 3 nights. The hotel is a small family run establishment and it is very well maintained throughout. The service was excellent and the rooms were immaculately clean and well presented. The breakfast, served on the roof terrace, was sufficient. The hotel is in an excellent location, within easy walking distance of the Spanish steps and the Trevi Fountain. The air conditioning was a bit noisy but we didn't lose any sleep over it. Overall, a very nice stay in a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price...”
Reviews.Author: missjenni
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 nights at the Concordia based on reviews on TripAdvisor and was not disappointed. Centrally located, safe neighborhood, stones throw from Piazza de Spagna and Trevi Fountain, close to Metro, great price, clean rooms, very friendly staff. Can't say enough good things about them & will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DSCmePleasanton_CA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Concordia, based on Reviews and Travel Guides. The hotel staff was very attentive and helpful. Providing us with routes and maps to every attraction we wanted to see. They had great advise for us on every days adventure. Yes the rooms are bit small but this is to be expected in European hotels. They were nicely appointed and the bathrooms where above average size. The bed was the most comfortable we found in all of the hotels we stayed at in Italy. This hotel is close to everything, except the Vatican. We walked to the Spanish Steps, Coliseum, Pantheon, Forum and Trevi Fountain. If you want to go to the Vatican you like us may opt to take the Metro. But the hotel staff was helpful in explaining which train and which stop to take and how to purchase tickets. The breakfast was the best we had during our trip and the hotel staff serving breakfast where very friendly every morning. Thank you Hotel Concordia for helping us have a terrific visit in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not the place for light sleepers”
Reviews.Author: lasocal
Reviews.Content: Concordia is very well located and it was easy to walk to almost any location in central Rome within about 15 minutes. The rooms are indeed small, though no smaller than similar hotels in New York City. The room was very clean and the air conditioning worked very well, which was great given that Rome was quite hot when we were there. The breakfast was fine though the pastries were not that great, nor was the coffee. The staff were always helpful if not always effusive. There were a number of things that we found disappointing. First, although street noise was not much of a problem, the walls are very thin and we heard a lot of noise from neighboring rooms. Light sleepers may want to look elsewhere. Second, although the hotel is supposedly non-smoking, the common areas smelled fairly strongly of smoke. This is the only hotel that we have stayed at in Rome so we don't have a good comparison, but it seems like one should be able to expect a little bit more for over 200 euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “Reality bite”
Reviews.Author: SheMag
Reviews.Content: Now a couple of things before the praise - yes, there's a rooftop to have your breakfast on, but there's no view except from one end towards St Peters, you can't reach the terrace if you're fat (VERY narrow staircase) or have problems with stairs (there is a lift but it only starts on the first floor and it stops two staircases below the roof). It's also fair to say that the breakfast is basic even for Europe - one type of meat and the rest is the usual bread, jam and cheese fare. That said, the staff understand the importance of boiling water fo tea, and that cold milk, not hot, is also important! The other observation - when the postings talk about small rooms, they REALLY mean it. But I have to tell you - all the postings about the friendliness of the staff are absolutely true. In addition, I have never stayed in a room so obsessively clean in my life, and I've stayed in the best hotels in Europe. I have a back injury at present and spent quite some time flat on the floor, so trust me, when I say it's clean I really know. Finally, thank God, it's true, the air conditioning is "proper" air conditioning, not a gasping box in the corner like so many Rome hotels. It is preset at 19 degrees, which might be a problem if you like it REALLY cold, but the contrast between 19 degrees and the outside makes it a liveable temperature. Ultimately would we recommend it? Without hesitation, to slim (or even moderately plump!) stair-friendly people only looking to stay in Rome for a couple of days. More than that and the size of the room would become a real challenge.

Reviews.Title: “Reputation well-proven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Most comfortable! Good price especially for the great location. Every staff member attentive and most helpful. Having left my passport in the room safe, due to staff's concern and diligence, I received it in good time before leaving Italy. I look forward to my next trip to Rome and to the Concordia.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but could do with some modernisation”
Reviews.Author: flopsey
Reviews.Content: Hotel Concordia cannot be faulted on it's location and it's staff. I would certainly reccomend it to anyone. The whole hotel was wonderfully clean and personally I didn't think the rooms were that small . However, I haven't awarded five stars because the decor and furnishings are in need of an update and their is alot of noise from rooms above - thin walls and floors I think. Little things like not using sachet toiletries and less prepacked food at breakfast would have brought things into the five star category for this price bracket. Overall a good experience and my compliments to the friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Decent Value”
Reviews.Author: PGPR
Reviews.Content: As others have noted, Concordia is a well-run hotel in a great location. It was clean, helpful staff, lovely rooftop breakfast room and I suppose, comparative to other high prices in Rome, a good choice for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Could not find fault with this little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susan24
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 5 days in this hotel which is well placed for easy walking to all the sites, bus station and metro. The staff are friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. The rooms are kept spotlessly clean and the bottles of water I took from the mini bar every day weren't put on my bill. Breakfast is cold buffet style, and has a varied selection, all served on a sunny, rooftop patio. The position of the hotel is in a side street, so traffic noise is a lot less than some other hotels. There are also bars and restaurants close to the hotel if you don't want to wander down to the main streets and piazzas. I would definitely return to the Concordia, it provided a good, comfortable base for this single traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grovemontjanet
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderfully situated and priced hotel near the Spanish steps and the Metro. The service is cordial and efficient and manager Stephano made sure we were well-looked after. Our room was immaculate and well-stocked, although on the street. We were too tired after walking all over Rome that we really didn't mind the night noise. The nice breakfast was served by friendly and interesting staff. We will book directly with the hotel next time we travel to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Concordia in late February with 3 friends for 3 nights. The rooms were a little compact but well furnished and spotlessly clean. It is hard to say enough about the friendliness and helpfulness of the chaps on reception. Amongst many other helpful tips, the restaurant recommendations they gave us each evening were spot on in every instance. Breakfast was varied and plentiful, and the staff very flexible about how late they would still serve (we had a couple of very late starts following some rather late nights). If you are returning to your room late at night I would recommend removing your shoes due to the wooden floors. We arrived from the airport after 11pm and the noise our heels made was not appreciated by the gentleman in the room below ours.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aunty_Melly
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel up from TripAdvisor in the first place and were really impressed with the location, facilities and friendly staff. Excellent value for money, great location - we walked to all the main attractions from there. Nice little terrace for breakfast, air con that works, everything clean and tidy and dead cheap drinks in the minibar! We would definitely stay again if we went back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Small but friendly”
Reviews.Author: mlecanada
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our one year anniversary trip to last September (which was also our first trip to Italy, France and England). We stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Concordia after reading the rave reviews on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed, per se, but I think my expectations may have been a bit too high.
