The people at the hotel are great, the rooftop breakfast was beautiful, and the location is fabulous. As well, they didn't charge us for the couple of beer we had from the mini bar, which was a welcome surprise (the clerk said since we paid s much for the room... which was true at $230 Euros per night!). Where my expectations were to high was the room itself - having been in Capri the few nights before in a suite overlooking the ocean, I was somewhat depressed by the typical teenie-weenie hotel room that plague Europe. The room was so small I don't think we could both stand up to leave at the same time. But there was a window that opened and a tiny balcony, of sorts. And they still turned down thebed each night even though I'm sure that must be hard to do given the proximity of the walls to the bed. All in all, it was a pleasant stay. My husband would not recommend the hotel again, but I definitely would. In fact my parents, in their 60's, stayed there last month and loved it. They appreicated the location and friendliness of the staff. Also, they planned a trip to Florence for one night and the Concordia held their golf clubs for that night so they wouldn't have to lug them to Florence and back.They were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not brilliant”
Reviews.Author: KimPlusFriends
Reviews.Content: Our group of four was greeted by the obligatory "aged parent involved in the business", so common in family-run Italian business, who managed to offend us immediately by arguing about the use of the word "bath" as opposed to "bath tub". I had written to the Concordia hotel after booking requesting en-suite bathrooms with a bath, not just a shower. On arrival we had only showers and a mouthful from the obligatory geriatric. If we had been told there were no bath TUBS, we would have booked elsewhere. Our rooms were very small but scrupulously clean. The location of the hotel is good, close to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain, in a pretty noisy road (quieter when compared to others in Rome), but do expect to walk quite a bit. Stefano was very helpful and pleasant, and Tony was outstanding, making brilliant recommendations on where to eat and how to get around - he was a real god-send. The breakfasts were fine by Italian hotel standards, with the hotel making an effort for Easter by giving chocolate and boiled eggs (if this is your first hotel in Rome, this breakfast is as good as they tend to get).

Reviews.Title: “Yet another positive review of Hotel Concordia”
Reviews.Author: jjkdc
Reviews.Content: A wonderful place to stay in a fantastic location at a very reasonable price. I stayed in Room #105, and it was tiny, as expected. But space is used efficiently, and once I threw my empty luggage cases on top of the cabinets I had no problem moving around. Rome is a very LOUD city with all the motorcycles and vespas scurring around, but the room was very quiet. Breakfast was fairly basic, but good. The cappucino was fantastic! The staff were all very friendly and welcoming. I could not recommend Hotel Concordia more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ghacker0
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights at this hotel. As all Trip Advisor reviews say, I agree this is an exceptionally clean, well positioned and friendly hotel. We flew with Ryanair and were sold tickets for the Terravision coach from the airport to the Termini station. I had thought that there was a station at the airport, but apparently this is not so. It was about a 40 min trip for 8 euros each which was not a bad price. We took a taxi from outside the Termini station, but just make sure you have the address of the hotel. I just said it was near the Spanish Steps, but the driver professed not to know it. We were dropped off at the Piazza Spana and asked about three different shop owners and some policemen and nobody knew. I then went to an exchange shop and it was literally a three minute walk and around the corner. If you want a bath, take your own plug as the only bath is on the fifth floor in the three bedded room which was very comfortable and a reasonable size compared to the doubles. Although there was a bath we were told that due to another couple flooding the place, there was no plug to avoid this happening again. Bubble wrap under the plughole perforated cover did the trick once the water pressure is enough. When you have walked for 8 hours you need a long soak. Weather was 75% rain but was sunny on the morning we visited the Basilica. Although it did rain, and at one stage after a horrendous thunderstorm, hailed like I have never seen anywhere before, it was still relatively warm. Wear layers in March. Advice given to us paid off. Go earlyish in the morning to the Basilica to avoid the crowds and don't go up to the top if you are claustrophobic as it got quite narrow and sloping at times. However, the views are worth it and I fought my fears. Coming down did not seem as bad for some reason. We only ate in one restaurant as it was close, good, and suited us. If you turn left from the hotel and go straight for about 5 minutes you get to a restaurant called Pizza Ciro (I think that was its name). We had three very good meals from pizza to steak (excellent fillet) and all for around £30 including a bottle of chianti and coffees. Ask Tony where it is. Would definitely stay at this hotel again if we returned to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Wondeful Choice!”
Reviews.Author: MobileResident
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at the Concordia earlier this month. The location of the hotel is great. It is a three minute walk to the Spanish Steps and the METRO and an easy walk to Trevi Fountain. The rooms are small but immaculately clean. The staff was friendly and very helpful. I thought our room was very quiet and the bed and pillows were very comfortable(we were in room #402).This would be a difficult place to stay if you are not fit enough to climb the spiral staircase. The elevator is tiny and starts one floor up from street level. I would definitely recommend the Concordia as a great place to stay to use as a base to explore Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wonderful small hotel. Clean, great location, friendly staff. The rooms were small but we expected that. Tony and the rest of the staff were extreemly helpful with resturant and site seeing suggestions. We were able to walk almost anywhere or take the Metro which was close by when needed. I look forward to my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “I'm with the minority opinion”
Reviews.Author: MGTB
Reviews.Content: For the past couple of years, all the hotels we have stayed in have been picked using Tripadvisor reviews. I go through the top 10 of any location and then look at location & price. Out of 187 reviews, 179 reviewers have given this hotel 5 stars but unfortunately, this time I was really disappointed. The pluses first: - It is immaculately clean (but shouldn't all hotels be?) - The location is really excellent - it's in a very nice area, close to the Spanish Steps & Trevi Fountain, metro stations & also right beside the best shopping area. - The restaurants that reception recommended were really excellent. - The bathroom was lovely and very spacious. The problems: - We had interrupted, uncomfortable sleeps for our whole stay - there were a number of reasons for this. The walls are very thin and you hear everything around you, above, below, outside. The bed and pillows were so uncomfortable, we both got sore backs and necks. There is no Do Not Disturb sign on the door so we were woken by housekeeping on a couple of occasions. Rest is really important on holiday and also when you're on a city break and you walk for miles everyday. I have to say this had a profound effect on our trip. - The rooms are small. - One of the reception staff seems annoyed to be asked anything at all to the point where I was beginning to believe I had somehow offended him. - The breakfast was really unimpressive. I'm sorry to say I would not stay in this hotel again and would not recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in superb location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came for our first visit to Rome in September 2005 and wanted to stay in a part of the city where we could walk to major sights- well the Concordia is in a great place-it was lovely to walk back via the Trevi fountain each evening,even saw a bride and groom on night having some amazing wedding photos! Rooms are small- as to be expected in the older quarters of the city but immaculately clean and well fitted furniture makes them very comfortable. Breakfast on the roof terrace- you can just see the dome of St.Peters in the distance.

Reviews.Title: “Rome in Februay”
Reviews.Author: Icelan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a delightful 3 night stay in the Concordia. Stayed there because of previous reviews and was not disappointed. The Hotel very clean with friendly and helpful staff. The Hotel is in walking distance for everything. Most things on the doorstep you need for an Italian experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: carrigman
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed in the Concordia for three nights in February and can thoroughly recommend it. It's conveniently located in the heart of Rome (The Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain are only minutes away). It is spotlessly clean and very well equipped. Our room had two single beds and size-wise was ample for the two of us. The reception staff - all men - were very friendly and helpful and spoke excellent english. There was no deposit payable for the room safe. We used the mini-bar for a few soft drinks but when I mentioned these at check out there was no charge. Breakfast is served from 7am and there is a wide selection of food to choose from. We checked out at 6.15am on the last day and the receptionist seemed pained that we were leaving without having breakfast. He was prepared to personally go the kitchen and put on the hot water so that we could have something to drink. We were in a hurry however so we had to decline whereupon he produced a tray of just delivered breads and croissants and insisted we take some with us. Excellent service. This is a hotel that will be my first choice when I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Came here thanks to Tripadvisor, and the choice was the right one. The things that stuck out since my return home was the friendliness of the staff, the super clean rooms and the fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before I start to write my review about Hotel Concordia in Rome I would like to say that I travel a lot for business. I saw many three star hotels in Italy but I never saw like this hotel. I stayed in Hotel Concordia for 3 nights with my wife and was satisfied with the staff the service and location. The rooms were small but very clean. I would like to say thanks to MR.Roberto, Mr.Rama and Mr.Tony with english accent for beeing helpful withs us. Hope to be back in the future. Greetings from Turkey

Reviews.Title: “Concordia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from spending three lovely days in Rome based at the concordia. It was a lovely hotel being quite central to everything, everywhere was walking distance. Hotel staff were very helpful, did find the hotel a little bit noisy early morning, ie dustbins being cleared outside etc. cannot fault the cleanliness, breakfast was ok. Would defintely return back to the hotel and absolutely loved Rome

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter94
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at the Concordia with my young adult sons, and found Roberto and his staff extraordinary. For example: they noticed my birthday on their record, and quietly offered a bottle of sparking wine and glasses, all beautifully presented. What I liked the most was the basement breakfast room. Sounds horrible? On the contrary: it is an absolute joy. Stunning decor, crisp tablecloths and everything from excellent muesli to fresh orange juice and the best Italian espresso. Oh yes, for the boys: hot chocolate made from chocolate. We went out and bought drinks, to save the usual minibar prices, only to be told that there is no charge for small items! The hotel is central and secure, and my sons could easily explore the local area on foot. We were directed to charming restaurants, and found everything we could possibly want within 5 mintues walk. At night we collapsed onto our comfortable beds, and slept soundly. If you truly want to experience the atmosphere of Rome, try the Concordia. Our enduring memory is being helped to our taxi and being waved farewell.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: liv2
Reviews.Content: Having looked at what seemed like hundreds of TripAdvisor hotels, we finally decided on the Hotel Concordia Rome (from 25th -29th Jan). We can positively say that we chose the right hotel. From the moment we arrived, Roberto and his staff made us feel so very welcome.They were all so friendly, courtious and willing to help in any way. We were provided with a map ( or 2) of Rome, given directions on how to get around and they also recommended some pretty good restaurants. Our room (double)was fine with everything we needed from a mini bar to a safe and we were pleasantly surprised by the tasteful decor. And most of all it was spotlessly clean and refreshed every day. Breakfast had a good range from yoghurts, cereals, pastries, fruit, meat and cheeses. In fact all details were true to their own website from the location of the hotel to the proximity of all the attractions. The hotel is approx 5 minutes walking distance from the Spanish Steps, which is a good base to start from and where you will find the Metro. The Vatican is about ten minutes from here...3 stops actually. The Trevi Fountain is about a 10 minute walk away. Most of Rome can be reached by foot but beware! wear good walking shoes! Hopefully we will return to Rome again soon and we will certainly stay at the Concordia, thanks to Roberto and his staff.

Reviews.Title: “splendid !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Its funny the way the reviews I had read on this hotel really did materialise, once we were there. During our 5 day stay we discovered an extremely friendly and clean hotel in a wonderful area. What more could you wish for? The rooms were more than comfortable, the small space available is put to very good use. On the front desk we had some wonderful conversation with Antonio(London-born) and the owner Roberto(40 years experience in the trade). We went to some wonderful restaurants in the area and in Trastevere, a 10 minute cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: mairebeth
Reviews.Content: just back from a 3 day stay at this hotel. the staff are excellent and could not do enough to make my stay a very pleasant one. breakfast again was good and the hotel is in a great location for to see all the sights in Rome. would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So clean, friendly and central.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Came here recently with my daughter, and we absolutely loved Rome and the Concordia.Could n't believe how cold Rome gets in the winter!! Our first trip to Italy and we felt so safe. The rooms were a little on the small side, to what we are used to, but the clean rooms, the friendly staff(Roberto,Tony,Rama),and the great location made our stay one to remember. Not only do they indicate to you the sights, but they are also full of tips and good advice, on how to move around in a big city like Rome.We really appreciated this. Breakfast was always fresh and enough for our taste. The Concordia was simply ideal for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights in January and loved it. It has all been said below. A triple and a double room was plenty of space for a family with three children. You can walk everywhere, even back into the park to the Zoo etc. for the kids. Couldn't really fault it for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent the New Year in Rome. We were 8 people and all of us feel that we chose the hotel well. The only complaint would be about the breakfast...a little poor. And if you do not plan on staying in the room for the entire journey (because it is small), then it's a great hotel. It's situated in the best area, 3 minutes to the spanish steps and virtually in the shopping area. Everything is close by, within walking distance...even a few good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “What we expected !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: So many good things have been said regarding this hotel and I am in total agreement. I would just like to re-emphasize the friendliness and cleanlines of the Concordia. The atmosphere is very familiar and informal,which was exactly what we were looking for. Rome is very lively and chaotic at times,so it was pleasant to return to what was "home", for 4 days. The location was ideal for walking,and visiting the main sights.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff is great. Very friendly. The rooms are terrific, very clean. The breakfast was very good. The location is fabulous. You are surrounded by the sights. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Thanks for making my family's vacation memorable for the right reasons.

Reviews.Title: “our Roman holiday was perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 wonderful days in this unique city, also thanks to the hospitality of this comfortable hotel.The moment we arrived, we were accompanied to our room, a key to the safety-box was given to us and we were told not to take excessive valuables,because of pick-pockets operating around tourist sights.Great tip. The hotel is located in a small and busy road, around the corner from the Spanish Steps.Moving around was very easy.There is a great chocolate shop close-by. Not far from the hotel there's a handy supermarket with "normal" prices. We did not find the rooms too small and they were ever so clean The staff are warm and always present for any questions. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't recommend this hotel enough!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here mid November. It was excellent value for money . The rooms were on the small side but immaculate and the staff were fantastic. We loved Rome and loved this hotel. We would not hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “intimate,very clean,so central.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rome was our first stop of our 15 day tour of Italy.It was simply overwhelming, fantastic.The Concordia, for me ,is the ideal place to stay,as a base.The guys on the front desk are informative and always helpful.One guy is English mother-tongue. Simona was very helpful at breakfast. The guests were mainly couples and families.The atmosphere was very easy-going.

Reviews.Title: “you won't find better !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the rate,location and quality of this hotel,I find it difficult to believe that you can find better. Okay the rooms were not the biggest we've been in, but the service was of a high standard. The staff were delightful.Warm and helpful.Each evening we went to some good trattorias, thanks to their tips.Go Mario or Nino close-by. Look forward to a near future return to this fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Concordia simply surpassed our expectations.The staff are unique.You will not find better staff to take care of you. Everything else has already been said!!

Reviews.Title: “What's all the fuss about”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Can't understand what all the fuss is about. On our 7th visit to Rome we stayed here based on the great rating given by other trip advisor writers and we were particularly unimpressed. Yes the hotel is central and very convenient. Yes the bathroom was large and clean. Yes the staff were friendly but........ the room was tiny, the breakfast average and the hotel inferior to other hotels we stayed in previously. (Marcella Royale, Palatino, Crown Plaza and others). There are definitely better hotels in Rome for a similar price. Peter & Marie Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: RS59
Reviews.Content: This hotel has two things going for it, the location and the staff. It is very central and many of the top attratctions are a comfortable walk. The staff are friendly and helpfull. They gave us great advice and our perfect day was sightseeing, maybe some shopping late afternoon and then a meal out in the evening. About 11pm we would end up in Gregory's Jazz Club (Google it!). The breakfast sorted the hangover then we would do it all again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Value, Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: londonyankeefan
Reviews.Content: Check out this hotel first when booking for Rome. While location, cleanliness and value (as mentioned in previous reviews) are all noteworthy - Concordia's outstanding characterisitic is the friendliness and usefulness of the staff. We received terrific recommendation after recommendation from the gracious front desk staff - they helped make a three day trip to Rome the best it possibly could be. Very happy I read about Hotel Concordia on Trip Advisor when I made plans. (PS-Gregory's, a good Jazz club, is a two minute walk from the front door of Concordia, 5 euro cover, intimate stage - go!)

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: CardiffManc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Concordia for 3 nights in Sept this year. I can't praise the hotel enough. The location is fantastic - just around the corner from the Spanish Steps and the Trevi fountain. We were able to walk to all the attractions from here, and I'm not the fittest of people! The rooms are on the small side (but who comes to Rome to sit in their hotel room?), but have everything you could need, and are very clean. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast on the rooftop terrace was lovely - great coffee and a good choice of cereals, bread, yoghurts, meat, cheese and fruit. I would happily stay here again on my next trip to Rome (I will be going back - I threw my coin in to the Trevi fountain!).

Reviews.Title: “Very very good indeed!”
Reviews.Author: btl
Reviews.Content: All the good reviews you have read on here are absolutely spot on. Excellent location, spotless facilities, brilliant staff. I would be very surprised if better value exists elsewhere in Rome. An absolute number one choice if visiting this city.

Reviews.Title: “small and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is one of the friendliest hotels I have ever been to.They simply pamper their clients.The rooms are simple, small, very clean, and generally comfortable. The breakfast is continental and more than adequate.They use a big coffee machine you see in the Italian bars.The staff is very accomodating. Close-by as well as sights, such as Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain, its full of bars, restaurants,shops. There is a London-born gentleman on the front desk. We went to a great Trattoria, Il Gabriello, ask for the address.Not far from the hotel. We shall be back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: chicagoland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Concordia for 4 nights in October. Despite on and off rain during our stay, we had a wonderful time. Hotel Concordia's biggest attraction is its location. Rome is such a large city, and yet this small boutique hotel is located on a side street between the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. We walked everywhere, including Vatican City, which took about 35 minutes. The rooms in this hotel are surprisingly small; yet they have everything that one would need. We were on the 5th floor - which meant 2 flights of stairs (stairs from the ground floor to the 1st floor and stairs from the 4th floor to the 5th floor) Breakfast was wonderful -- the best mueslix and hot chocolate we had during our entire trip to Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal”
Reviews.Author: TripDublin
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay in this hotel - there were 8 people in our group and everyone agreed that this hotel is an ideal base for visiting Rome. The location is excellent, with most of the major sites within easy walking distance. The staff are incredibly helpful and friendly - recommending restaurants, booking taxis, checking tourist information etc. Rooms are modern and clean and continental breakfast more than adequate. We would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: johnandmartha
Reviews.Content: Anyone who would wish to stay at the Hotel Concordia would be making a wonderful decision. It is a 3 star hotel but in our estimation, it is 5 star. Roberto, Stefano, Antonio, Wolfgang and all the staff are really great. The hotel rooms are kept spotlessly clean and contain a safe, refrigerator,air conditioner [which is self regulated] and a lovely new bathroom. It's right in the middle of many sights especially for me, the Trevi fountain, which is only a few blocks away. The Spagna station is about 5 minutes away and only 4 stops to the Vatican City. If ever we are able to return to Rome, we wouldn't think of staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: John_n_Tracy
Reviews.Content: Stay Here ! This Hotel really is that good. The staff are all very helpfull and speak good english. They are happy to help you with finding good places to eat and any other general advice you may need. We will definately stay here next time we come to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: TrionaL
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Concordia for 4 nights last week, and loved it. The location is fantastic - so convenient for all the sights. Our room was clean and comfortable, with a surprisingly large bathroom. The staff in the hotel were very helpful and the (continental) breakfast was delicious. The hotel is within a very short walk of wonderful restaurants and bars - it is an ideal base for a holiday in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Jodie M
Reviews.Content: This hotel does live up to the recommendations, we travelled to Rome last year and did not have any way near the experience we had this year at the Concordia. Great location, staff and clean. The rooftop is a bonus, we had breakfast up there each morning and then would take a bottle of wine up in the evening, great way to relax after sight seeing all day. Would love to stay there again and would recommend highly to active people as the lift is tiny and if you are on the 4th floor like us there are lots of stairs to climb. If you are older request a room on the 1st floor.

Reviews.Title: “Defeinitely recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Absolutely delighted with the standard.Spotlessly clean, staff extremely helpful. Location is ideally centrally located for major sight seeing.Perhaps a little more expensive than others in same category, but the group of eight I was in all thoroughly enjoyed it and would definitely return.Worth every penny.Just book it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise after a Long Flight”
Reviews.Author: nearPhila
Reviews.Content: We started our Italy vacation at Hotel Concordia for our first 2 nights. (We also stayed at Hotel Onda Verde in Praiano and then back to Rome at Teatro di Pompeo--reviews of both on TripAdvisor). The hotel is in a great location--very convenient to public transportation, Spanish Steps, Trevi, wonderful shops, etc. We found it comfortable and very clean with a courteous and helpful staff. I also found that in every hotel we stayed, hair dryers were provided, so don't worry about bringing yours and needing a plug adaptor. The only warning I will give is that the elevator is more like a closet and only 2 people can fit at a time! If you are a very large person, you may not feel comfortable with the elevator or the rooms and shower accomodations (it seems most showers in Italy are small for American standards and of the three hotels we stayed at while in Italy, Concordia's was in the middle--Hotel Teatro di Pompeo had the most roomy shower). Everything was fine for us, but I did find myself rolling over in bed and hitting the side cabinet once or twice (see photos of rooms). With that said, I would still stay there again. I loved the location, the cleanliness and courteous staff and would gladly recommend it to friends. Besides, you don't live in your hotel--there's way too much to see and do in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Purple_Inflatable
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a wonderful stay at this hotel, I felt I had to add my positive comments. I have never before stayed at a hotel where I was made to feel so welcome by the staff. The rooms, while small, are clean, comfortable and beautifully fitted and the breakfasts were delicious. The location is ideal, being so central means it is possible to walk to most, if not all, of the main attractions. My tip would be to ask Roberto for his advice for the best places to visit and dine - I did and had some memorable experiences as a result! As with so many other guests, on my next visit to Rome, I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “No better place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Calgarymember
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Concordia for 5 nights (Sept 15-22) and loved every minute of our stay. Roberto (who operates the hotel) and his staff are extremely welcoming, helpful to their guests, and very professional in all they do. The attention to detail was outstanding. To quote Roberto, "we need clients to pay our bills, but we prefer that they feel they are our guests". Our room was very clean, nicely appointed (including a room safe), generous in size by European standards and very well air-conditioned. The windows were extremely sound-proof from the exterior when closed. The location could not have been better, being between the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain and a very convenient and highly interesting walk to Rome's major attractions. Breakfasts are on a very cheery rooftop patio or in the event of inclement weather, are in a very well appointed and bright dining area in the lower level of the hotel. We have been to Rome previously and now would not consider staying anywhere else on our future visits. We truly did feel like guests at the Concordia.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Marclaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Concordia for three nights, from September 2-5 prior to a cruise. While all of the comments about the size of the rooms (incredibly small) in hotel are true, it is also true that hey are spotlessly clean, and that you spend virtually no time in them. There is so much to do in Rome, and this hotel is so well located that the size of the rooms are irrelevant. You are literally just minutes away from the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. The Pantheon is also within easy walking distance. While it was a long walk, we were even able to make it to Vatacin City in about 35 minutes, tour the museum/St. Peters/Sistine Chapel, walk back alonf the Tiber to Tibernia Island, through the Jewish Ghetto and back to the hotel in one day. All of the comments here about the hotel staf are also accurate -- they speak excellent English, are friendly, and will do whatever they can to make your visit enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “The right choice for our family!”
Reviews.Author: OnTheMove
Reviews.Content: We made our first trip to Rome in March 2005. After reading endless reviews of various hotels & agonizing over which neighborhood we should stay in, we chose the Hotel Concordia. It was definitely the right choice for us. Location is everything--this hotel is in a relatively quiet neighborhood and an easy walk to any of the major sites--even with sometimes reluctant children (10, 14 & 18) in tow! We rented 2 rooms on the same floor, just steps from each other & it worked out beautifully. Us in one, kids in the other. Plenty of room for all of us...we were there mostly to sleep & rest briefly between our various travels. Breakfast was ample--we didn't expect a hot meal and the cereal, rolls, coffee etc was just right for us. Staff was superb. Mr. Roberto, full of stories and good advice, others were also very helpful and friendly. The hotel arranged a limo from the airport, which worked out very well. All in all, this was a really great experience. I'm so glad that we stayed there--it's great to be close to things & still be able to get away to this place that felt like home. All of us were very happy with the Hotel Concordia & we'd stay there again in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “High praise for the Concordia in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: sappel54
Reviews.Content: We looked at the reviews for this hotel, and decided to book a three-day stay there during a September Italy trip. It was the right decision. The Concordia is a nice little gem of a hotel in a great location, just down the block from the Spanish Steps, a short walk from the Trevi Fountain, and within walking distance of all major Rome attractions. Even a trip to the Vatican was just a 5 minute ride on the subway. The rooms are small, but average by European standards, and spotlessly clean and well appointed. The Continental breakfasts on the beautiful rooftop garden terrace were a perfect start to each day. The staff are helpful and attentive. You really can't go wrong by choosing this Hotel. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: k527newman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Concordia between 9/6 - 9/10. My husband and I just returned from our vacation. When I was looking into hotels in Rome, I wanted a small boutique style hotel instead of those chain ones. I was hoping to find a friendly staff and we sure got it. Everyone that works at this family-owned hotel was very friendly and helpful. Many of the staff spoke decent English, which was a great help! The room, although not very big compared to our American taste, was an adequate size. Moreover, both the room and bathroom were clean, which is a definite plus. As for location of the hotel, you can't beat this. We were able to walk everywhere from the hotel. The Coliseum, the Pantheon, Piazza Navona, and Trevi Fountain were all walking distance from the hotel. You're just a block away from the Spanish Steps which has a subway stop so you can take the subway to the Vatican City. We definitely recommend staying here if you should visit Rome. This will be our first choice if we ever come back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I think most of the good points have already been mentioned,I would just like to re-emphasize the good standard of this hotel.It really is run in an enthusiastic way by its staff, and as a result the guests benefit.They make you feel at home. The only criticism is the tiny elevator.I prefered the stairs!! We loved our stay in Rome, thanks also to the Hotel Concordia.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Chesterfield_1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Concordia for 4 nights in September and we loved it. We reserved one of the small rooms (105) at a special rate, and although it was indeed small, it was very nice. Everything was very clean and new-looking, especially the bathroom. Our room was smartly decorated and equipped with safe, minibar, satellite television (with a few Engligh-speaking channels), hairdryer and great air conditioning. The smallness of the room really didn't bother us because of all this, plus we weren't in it for much of the day. Breakfasts good choice and views. Great location, too, the Spanish Steps and Metro are very very close, as is the Trevi Fountain. All the other sights are easily accessible, and the surrounding streets are full of posh shops and feel very safe at night. Especially worth visiting is a little Trattoria recommended by one of the lovely men on Reception- turn left at the bottom of Via Capo le Case, go down the street until you reach a main road, cross the road to get to a newspaper stand (closed at night), and opposite that is a really lovely restaurant with seating outside behind some plants. It has pictures of famous people who've been there discreetly on the walls, but the prices are cheap! Also, there is an amazing Blue Ice gelateria on the road as you turn left at the bottom of Via Capo le Case. Not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat for cleanliness and location”
Reviews.Author: Amberley46
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Concordia. All the plaudits of others who have been there are true and we really enjoyed our stay. Yes, some might think the rooms are small but they are more than adequate and anyway when in Rome who wants to sit in their room. The terrace was great for breakfast and for relaxing with a pre dinner bottle of wine after having worn oneself out "doing the sights" Would certainly recommend to any friends that were going.

Reviews.Title: “small is beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Came in mid-August for a 5 day break and loved every moment of it.As a woman travelling alone, I felt very safe going out at nights, the hotel is located in a very safe neighborhood.It is small, clean, and family-run.The staff could n't be nicer, they are all English-speaking.I found the room to be comfortable, functional, and so clean.The bathroom was brightly decorated and spacious.You will not come across a better hotel in its category, and I have travelled extensively!!

Reviews.Title: “Our expectations were fulfilled”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel Concordia thanks to Tripadvisor.My boyfriend and I spent most of August travelling to Italy and Greece.We spent 4 wonderful days here, and can say that the Concordia was our favourite stay. Most of the guests were couples and families with children.The atmosphere in the hotel was very homely and laid back. A piece of advice avoid the pizza place across the road - what a rip off! We can only sum up everything by saying that the good reviews are all so true.

Reviews.Title: “we felt at home !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days with my family at this wonderful little hotel. You will not find a better hotel for the price we paid. We came in August, which is meant to be low season in Rome. But it was still very busy. The museums were always full of people, and the few restaurants which remained open were always packed. Each night we were advised by Tony ( londoner) on a restaurant. He was always helpful with advise on being aware of pick-pockets and literally guided us towards a great stay. The girls at breakfast were always friendly. Could not have hoped for a better stay!

Reviews.Title: “OK- but some disappointments”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not small, they are very small, even by Euro standards. The bed is so small - my feet hung over the end, I am 6'2" - but this did not happen in any other of 7 hotels we stayed at in Italy. The shower was actually smaller than our standard cabin shower on our cruise we took- too small...we banged our elbows throughout our showers We had to drag some of our own heavy bags (30 day trip) up to the "second" floor to reach the "elevator" by our selves, as there was only one guy on duty when we checked in about 5:00 PM. Breakfast was good, nice terrace, nice people/staff, decent location, and reasonable price. We would stay somewhere else when we return to Rome. I recommend you find a place near the center of Rome, like the Pantheon area. I know you can get to all of Rome fom the Concordia on foot, metro, cab. etc. we did it all, it is just that this Hotel is not in the center --all the action is there.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for a trip to Rome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were staying in the Concordia hotel in early March, after having quite some trouble finding a decent hotel in a central location. This hotel actually is a little gem! Very close to the Spanish steps and the fontana di Trevi - but only a few minutes away from the main station and yet situated in a rather quiet street. What makes this hotel unique is the very friendly staff, the close attention the guest is paid to (also when contacting the owner prior to arrival because of specific queries by email), and the overall cleanliness of the rooms. The owner is (at least) tri-lingual (Italian, English and German) and very knowledgeable and helpful for suggesting good restaurants, etc. Good breakfast, again with quite decent yet attentive waitress. Overall, the perfect hotel to stay for a stay in the Eternal City! Not too expensive, rather quiet and yet central location, and comfortable settings...

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: travelinggrandpa11
Reviews.Content: Our group of 10 stayed at the Concordia prior to our cruise. Our selection was based on the comments posted on the Tripadvisor. We were not disappointed. This quaint little hotel in the Central historic district of Rome lived up to it's expectations. The rooms are small, clean and the staff is outstanding. Roberto, Stephano and Anthony took care of our every need. Tansportation from the airport and to the ship, restaurant recommendations, private tour drivers etc.. Most historic sights are within walking distance. Our group has traveled all over the world and stayed at many hotels. This one truly lived up to it's reputation for value as well as a "Ritz Carlton" service attitude. Due yourself a favor and check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Concordia”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Be prepared for very small rooms indeed. However, our room was spotlessly clean well decorated and functional. The hotel is ideally located for all the main attractions. The staff make this hotel. They are very knowlegable of the city and transportation and are always very happy to help. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Never been in a hotel with such lovely friendly personnel and we have been in many! From the start they welcome you with the most honest friendlest smile. First you think its coincidence till you notice that it happens every day and you only meet more nice people in the hotel like the wonderfull Simone and Franka! You think you found the family you never had! And in general people in Rome are so friendly. Even the waiter from the restaurant walked us home under his umbrella so we didn t had to walk in the rain from the restauant to the hotel. But on number one are definately Rama and Antonio.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic weekend in Rome. Our location was ideal-we stayed in the Concordia hotel which is literally just round the corner from the Spanish Steps. The Hotel is small but compact and very clean although and I wouldn't recommend it to families with small children, or people with walking difficulties as there are quite alot of stairs to climb, but it was perfect for us. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful and went out of their way to ensure we had a great weekend. I would thoroughly recommend staying here. Watch out for the pizza place across the road from the Hotel- it is a tourist trap- we got charged 41 euros for 2 beers and a small slice of pizza

Reviews.Title: “Great convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mloftis
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed four nights at the Hotel Concordia in early August. The hotel arranged for us to be picked up by private car at the airport, which was wonderful since we had never been to Rome and did not have to figure out the transportation system or worry about carrying our bags. The driver spoke some english and was waiting with a sign as we came out of the luggage area. The hotel staff were all execellent. Most could comunicate in English and the front desk men were very well spoken. Tony was especially good helping with directions and getting a Taxi when needed, though that was rare since we could walk to almost any attraction within 30 minutes. The Spanish steps and Trevi fountain were five minutes away and the Colosseum was about 20-25 minutes. The Vatican was about 35-40 minutes and we took a cab for our 8:00AM tour. (Take advantage of some of the small Group tours for major attractions, it is worth the money. We used Roman Promenades.) We did walk back from teh Vatican stopping at several Piazza's and sights along the way. The hotel staff kept the rooms fresh with linens and the minibar stocked with water and soft drinks. The room was a bit small by some standards but very clean and well done. Each room has a private bath with a shower or tub. We were never bothered with street noise and it was quite at all times. Breakfast on the rooftop dining area was all we wanted with pasteries, juce, tea, coffee and cereal. Our room had a small balcony with a great view. We could even see St. Peter's Dome in the distance. Rome is a great place to visit and the Condordia is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Way to Stay in Rome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay for 4 nights and couldn't be happier with the hotel. The staff was always friendly and helpful, the view from the roof (for breakfast) was great, if we had questions they were answered. Although the rooms were smaller than expected it was always clean and comfortable. If we ever have to stay in Rome again, this will be the place. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT TO ANYONE!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel During our Trip to Europe!”
Reviews.Author: Greg00
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2-week trip to Europe. The Concordia was one of our best memories and by far the best hotel we stayed (including so-called 5-star hotels in Amsterdam). Each day began with a great breakfast (included) on the roof. We felt like we were the only guests, although it was full. The owner is the nicest guy, and called taxis for us and opened the doors for our family of four. Granted, the rooms are a little small, but just right, and the bathrooms are very spacious and clean. The staff enjoys working here and it shows. This hotel gets 5-stars from our family! We've already recommended it to friends traveling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in July. Incredible staff. Roberto(owner), Stefano, Wolfango, Anna and everyone who worked in the hotel made us feel very at home. Immaculate rooms and bathrooms. Nice thick towels, dual voltage outlets in bathrooms, comfy beds. Small rooms but typical of European rooms. Roof top terrace was an awesome way to start the day. Breakfast was a nice selection - 2 or 3 kinds of cereal, variety of sweet rolls, fruit, cold cuts, yogurt, cappuccino and cafe Americano. Staff helped with airport transportation - 40 euros one way. This hotel is a real jewel and we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable, fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights in July 2005. The first place on our honeymoon trip. A very charming friendly hotel with a nice room and a fun little lift to ride in. Great location for all our site seeing. Would love to be here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome after staying in the wonderful Hotel Concordia. My husband had his wallet stolen just after arriving in Rome (look out for pickpockets around airport buses and taxi rank at the train terminal). On arriving at the the hotel the staff couldn't have been more helpful. They had a list of numbers to ring through to to stop the credit cards and rang through for us on their phone, then pointed us in the right direction for the police station, just a short walk away, saying if we had any language problems to ring them, their English is perfect incidentally. Despite all this nothing spoilt our enjoyment of Rome, so much to see and the hotel is in a perfect location to walk to everywhere, however we did catch the metro over to the vatican as the weather was too hot to walk that far, would not have been a problem if weather was cooler. Hotel staff were so helpful with information on restuarants and how to get to places. The room was immaculate with the comfiest hotel bed and pillows Ive ever had! Breakfast on the roof terrace was the perfect way to start every day. Will certainly be returning to Rome and would only want to stay at this perfect hotel. I was almost reluctant to write anything on this site as do not want this place to get too popular!

Reviews.Title: “Just amazing”
Reviews.Author: Fi_and_Andy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a 6 night stay at this lovely little hotel. The family who run it are so helpful, speak very good English and can recomend good resturants and tours. It is located on a quiet side street just minutes from both the Trevi Fountain and Spanish steps with plenty of local bars, shops and cafes. We chatted to other residents who all shared our views. The room was very clean and well layed out with sweet little balcony (4th floor). We stay in quite a few hotels and I can usualy find some fault or problem, even in the pricey ones, but this place was just right. Small and very well run. The lift is tiny and not wheelchair compatible. We will almost certainly be going back to Rome and will stay at the Concordia if they have the room.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff Makes this Incredible Hotel Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: texgatorAustin_TX
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 1/2 weeks in France and Italy, where we started in Paris at a 5 star "big-name" hotel, then went on to Tuscany where we stayed in a beautiful villa, then on to Rome where I must say we were nervous about staying in this "unknown" little hotel. But the location seemed great and the reviews on TripAdvisor were impeccable, so we gambled and booked a room.....What a great decision!!! From the very minute we arrived at the hotel via taxi (and the owner came out and scared off the unscrupilous taxi driver who was attempting to pull a fast switch-a-roo rip-off with me by hiding Euro's I had just given him!), we knew this was going to be a great place. The owner and the staff (Stefano, Wolfgang, etc.) were all 100% FANTASTIC, giving us great recommendations on dining, touring, even arranging transportation and on and on. I can absolutely state that the service we received was better than at the 5 star hotel or the $$$$ villa. And the fact that these folks were so genuinely nice and interesting to boot, made the whole place even better. As you can read in other reviews, the hotel is incredibly clean, up to date, beautiful roof top breakfast and on and on (and I was very impressed with the hardwood (Olive wood!) in the rooms and just outside). But what I didn't get from the reviews was how incredibly great the hotel staff was. They truly make the place incredible!

Reviews.Title: “It is all true!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Hotel Concordia, having selected it through tripadvisor (thank you!). All the praise you read in these reviews is well justified. We stayed on the fourth floor, and our room had a small balcony that overlooked the street. It was not at all noisy, we even managed an afternoon nap! Breakfast in the roof garden was incredible, with some amazing views over the city. On our first morning, there was a short thunderstorm whilst we were having breakfast, and the staff closed the remote controlled awning just in time, and breakfast continued without interruption! This is a family run hotel, and they all take pleasure in going the extra mile to ensure that your visit to Rome is the experience you dreamed of. Take the time to stop and chat at reception, it will be time well spent; we were pointed towards the student district just over the river, to eat. We found that the many bars and restaurants over there could feed us really well for less than half the price you paid in the main tourist areas. Particularly recommend the Carlo Menta Restaurant, which serves non stop from midday to 23:30 hrs. - two huge pizzas, coke, sprite, and a large bottle of still water - €15 !!!! Thanks to all at the Concordia for giving us a wonderful time. We shall be back!! Regards, Elliott & May from Cambridge UK.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel for those Traveling Solo too!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my trip to Italy to visit friends up north and on my way back I stayed in Rome for 2 nights at Hotel Concordia! I stayed there alone and felt really safe. What a fab place!! The staff is wonderful and ready to help with any questions you may have! VERY clean & breakfast on the rooftop terrace was great! The area is very safe and great to walk around in. Spanish steps & Trevi Fountain are so close by! So are all the shops!!! Will definitely stay there on my next trip to Italia! I will be back there since I did throw the coin over my shoulder into the Trevi Fountain! :)

Reviews.Title: “Will Not Disappoint”
Reviews.Author: rmerrill
Reviews.Content: Like many others, we too love the Concordia. We stayed there two different times on our trip. In late June we were there for four nights. Then, after we traveled around Italy for two weeks, we stayed there again for two nights before returning home to the states. Both visits were great. When we arrived for our first visit, unfortunately, the hotel did not have the reservation we had booked through Venere. I think it was a communication problem on the part of Venere, but it was not an issue one way or another because the Concordia was totally accommodating and gave us excellent rooms (nice balcony!) at the rate we had confirmed with Venere. We loved the staff. They were very helpful with excellent restaurant recommendations, directions, and sight-seeing info. My mom loved the staff so much that she even invited the owner to come and visit us in Texas. The rooms were clean and well maintained, bathrooms were nice, rooms were well air conditioned (important for my dad), and breakfast on the terrace was lovely. Also, the minibar was stocked with water & sodas regularly, and in the end they didn't even charge us for it (of course, it's important to note that we didn't clean out the minibar; we just drank the bottled water). Finally, the location is great. It was very easy to walk to most major sights or take the metro from Spanga. Also, the hotel was well-located for morning jogs in the Pincio and Borghese gardens. I can't rave enough about this hotel. In the future, I will only stay here when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Hotel Concordia”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned home from three nights in beautiful Rome, Italy. In addition to amazing sight-seeing, we stayed at an amazing hotel, the Hotel Concordia. The staff was welcoming, helpful and ultimately pleased that we chose them during our stay in Rome. Complimentary breakfast was served on a terrace overlooking the city with wait staff ready to treat you like royalty. I highly recommend this hotel. We loved every moment we were in Rome; with much thanks to the Hotel Concordia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CatLady
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my 3 day stay. All I can say is this hotel is wonderful. The staff is outstanding. They went hand over foot for my 5 year old. Breakfast on the roof top terrace was plentiful, delicious and a wonderful view to boot. The room was small but, that is the norm for Rome. The hotel was clean, the bed was comfortable and close to everything. I can't wait for my return. Gerri

Reviews.Title: “Concordia: Best Bang for the Buck in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LeGenerale
Reviews.Content: Best bang for the buck in Rome. Thanks to Roberto, Stefano, Antonio, and staff, the Concordia offers the best combination of quality, location, and welcome we have found in a long time. Yes, the rooms are small and if that's a problem, go elsewhere. But that's not much of a drawback when you consider the friendliness and the attention to detail . . . plus breakfast on the roof terrace with a wonderful view. Note to computer users: There's a dialup connection in the rooms, but only one high-speed connection, an ethernet cable at the front desk. Roberto is thinking about providing a separate area with additional connections. A great place!

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Concordia. You already know that the rooms at the Concordia are small, though our bathroom was relatively large. The hotel is very clean and very well-maintained. The staff is very accommodating and friendly. Location is also great: very near the Piazza di Spagna, but on a side street that doesn't get much traffic at night. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to, except for the Vatican. The size of the room was not bothersome since we spent most of our time out and about, which was easy because of the central location. It was very nice to be able to drop by during the day to take a rest or drop things off. My problem with the Concordia was that the bed was a little short for me (and I'm not especially tall) and a bit softer than I like. Given its location, the Concordia has reasonable rates. If I go back to Rome in the near future, I will definitely consider staying there, but I would investigate other accommodations too.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: windsor
Reviews.Content: We can't imagine staying anywhere else in Rome- and after staying in four hotels in Europe in two weeks, we realize what a difference the hotel staff can make. We got a warm welcome from whomever was sitting behind the desk, no matter what time we arrived. Breakfast on the rooftop was an outstanding way to start each day, big fluffy towels, crisp sheets, spotless rooms, air conditioning and a reliable safe. Airline lost our luggage, and the staff completely took over making the necessary phone calls to track it down. What a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Concordia was the Best!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the privilege to stay at the Hotel Concordia for 2 nights last week. We were so impressed by the perfect location (so close to the Spanish Steps), the beautiful room, and the incredibly friendly & helpful staff. Roberto was a wonderful host and could not have been any more hospitable. He and his staff took every opportunity to make sure our stay was enjoyable. They gave us directions around the city, booked us dinner reservations, arranged a car service to the airport, and even gave us a bottle of wine to take home! Next time we have the pleasure of visiting Rome, Hotel Concordia is the only place we'll stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service”
Reviews.Author: Yfandes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Concordia for 4 days. The hotel owner was incredibly friendly and helpful. He gave us hotel recommendations and directional advice. The staff helped us recover a bag that my mom left in a taxi. The room was clean and large enough (barely) for 3 of us to stay in it. The location is excellent--right by the Spanish Steps. The in-room fridge is a bargain. They had water in there cheaper than it was being sold at shops on the streets, so we just bought the hotel's bottled water. Our stay there was lovely. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Simply put, the Concordia Hotel was excellent, especially for the price (180 euro). The hotel and our room were updated and very clean. Our room had beautiful hardwoods with clean, nice tile in the bathroom. The bathroom was spotless. The room had air conditioning that worked very well. The bed was comfortable and the bedding was very clean. We had a window that was ceiling to floor with shutters that open out on to a small porch to stand on (not sit). The hotel has a roof-top terrace where breakfast is served in the morning and drinks in the afternoon. The owner and his staff are very friendly and accomodating. The Concordia is just a few blocks from Rome's central train station (we walked). It is also just a few blocks from the Spanish Steps, the shops on Via de Condotti, and the Trevi Fountain and it is a short walk to the Pantheon. It is also not far from the Borgehese Park if you want an early morning or late afternoon jog. Overall, I was thrilled with the Concordia.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 very enjoyable days in Rome. Hotel was very central & all main attractions were within say 25 mins max walking distance. Room was very clean & comfortable & all staff friendly & helpful. Morning breakfast on the roof top terrace & an early evening pre going out drink (supplied by yourself) made the stay even more enjoyable. Roberto the owner was a very friendly & genuine gent who wasn't adverse to recounting his lifestory. Would certainly recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: joetheboss
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews, the expectations were high.We were n't disappointed.We encountered the most friendly staff, who it seems, take pleasure in directing the traveller in the right direction.The hotel itself is simple, clean, and well located.Rooms are not enormous, but space is taken care of in the most efficient way.The breakfast on the terrace, will put you in the right frame of mind, to explore this incredible and sometimes over-powering city.The hotel was great for re-charging lost energy,after walking the cobbled streets.Take comfortable shoes!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Nice Location, Great breakfast juices,”
Reviews.Author: markpay
Reviews.Content: We really loved staying at the Hotel Concordia. It rained most of the days we stayed there, and they had oversized umbrella's and plenty of advise to help us navagate and find places to eat etc. The room was small but very nice. The bathroom was great. There are only a few English channels on T.V. but who is there to watch T.V.? I have to mention the juices. They were REALLY good. They also had a great continental breakfast. Lots of verity. We really enjoyed our stay. Thanks to all the earlier posts for their comments. They were right on.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3 star hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights as past of our honeymoon. The hotel is a 9 euro taxi ride from the Termini - be sure to get an offical taxi at the taxi stand as there are many unscrupulous deadbeats approaching you before you make it to the stand. The location is perfect - 2 minutes to the Spanish steps and Trevi fountain and within walking distance of the Colosseum, Vatican, Pathenon etc. We didn't have to use public transport at any time during our stay. The staff were very friendly and spoke perfect English although don't take their restaurant advice (La Rampa) as it was a terrible tourist trap. A good choice near the Trevi Foutain is Vineria Chianti - great food service at reasonable prices. This hotel is great for someone wanting a very clean, family-run hotel in a great location. Breakfast on the beautiful roof-top terrace was a nice plus as well.

Reviews.Title: “Concordia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hereHouston
Reviews.Content: Everything we have read in other reviews was true. Hotel rooms were small compared to American hotel rooms, but space was well utilized especially in the room we stayed in. The room was spotless. The staff was excellent. Breakfast was great...especially the coffee. LOCATION..LOCATION...LOCATION. Spanish Steps..5 minute walk...Trevi Fountain...10 minute walk...Pantheon...20 minutes tops and another 5 minutes to Piazza Navona. Great shopping within 10 minute walking distance. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - believe the reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a five day trip to Rome with my girlfriend. We booked this hotel after reading the reviews on this site and it did not disappoint. The hotel is located in a great spot, between the Spagna and Barberini train stops (about a five minute walk from either). All major attractions are within walking distance and the rooms, although small, are clean, comfortable and air conditioned. The breakfasts on the roof are a great way to start the day. The food is relatively simple but of good quality, and the view and setting are fantastic. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful, making an effort to know and talk to their guests. Overall, it's great value considering the location, comfort and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great Roman holiday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We came to this place thanks to Tripadvisor and I must say that my expectations were fully fulfilled.The owner Signor Roberto entertains his guests with tips and good old chat.He certainly knows how to treat the visitor.The rooms are kept so clean.We were able to use the internet free of charge.Moving around was so easy thanks to its fantastically central location.We enjoyed every moment in this little family-run roman hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Totally enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 4 day stay at the Concordia Hotel and could not fault it in any way.It is in a very busy part of the city.During the day it bustles with noise and activity.Shops, bars, restaurants, offices liven up this busy neighborhood, as well as the army of tourists that pour into it. Fortunately by the time night falls the street is more suttle and calm.So the noise is virtually non-existent.We especially liked this hotel because of the family atmosphere and friendliness of the staff, as well as the clean rooms which awaited us.The breakfast on the roof-terrace each morning was simply fantastic, and nicely presented.We highly advise this no frills, family-run, friendly and clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trip of a Lifetime”
Reviews.Author: SuedeMan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 10-day trip to Italy, of which we spent 5 in Rome. We had a fabulous time. We stayed at the Hotel Concordia, which is very conveniently located between the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. It's also quite close to two Metro stops. We were within walking distance of almost all the major sites. We even walked back from the Vatican one evening, which was probably the site furthest away from our hotel. The staff of the Hotel Concorida was very friendly and extremely helpful. My favorite part of the hotel was the breakfast on the rooftop every morning. Our room was very nice and clean. We had our own bathroom and AC. We saw many sites that were incredible. Our favorites included: The Colosseum - we picked up a guided tour outside of the gate. Well worth it for both the information and the ability to skip the long line. St. Peter's & The Vatican Museum - The climb to the top of St. Peter's is well worth the view and the Sistine Chapel was amazing. But just about everything was amazing in the Vatican museum. But be ready for some big crowds in the museum and watch for the Tourist Trap restuarants outside the Vatican. Trevi Fountain - This fountain was on of my favorites, squeezed into its plaza was amazing. Although crowded, it was a relaxing place to sit and relax. The Pantheon - This is truly a mavel of construction, and I really liked the neighorhood around this. A lot of good places to eat or snack. Catacombs - We toured the Catacombs of San Callisto. We took a bus (only about 20 minute ride) from the station near San Giovani. It was fairly easy to get to. Just seeing the catacombs themselves and learning what early Christians went through to worship were both amazing. Roman Forum - This was fun to see and try to imagine what things were like 1800 years ago. Highly recommended to either get a guided tour (if you can find one, we couldn't) or get a highly detailed guidebook fo this area, as we tried to use my Rome guidebook and couldn't figure out what was what. Churches - Just about every church we stepped into was amazing. Some of my favories were St. Paul's (outside the walls), San Giovani, and St. Peter's. But many of the lesser known churches are amazing as well. For the most part, we ate very well. Some of our best bargains for sit-down meals were at wine bars that had tables in the back for eating. There's a lot we missed, so we'll have to go back. Certianly, the trip of a lifetime!

Reviews.Title: “Terrrific choice”
Reviews.Author: Seaburn
Reviews.Content: We've just spent a few days at Hotel Concordia and it was excellent. We chose it because of the exceptionally good reviews on Trip Advisor and they weren't wrong. It is just so homely and spotlessly clean. The staff are the most courteous and helpful I have encountered in a city hotel anywhere, always ready to give tips on attractions and restaurants. There are lots of bars and restaurants close by. The staff are happy for you to use the excellent roof-top terrace for your own drinks in the early evening. It has a nice view of the city including the dome of St. Peter's. The terrace is also where a very good continental buffet breakfast was served. The rooms are a little small but you don't need an awful lot of space unless you intend spending all your time in the hotel. The hotel is spotlessly clean throughout and everything was well maintained. The Spanish Steps are about 300 metres away and the Trevi Fountain not much further. Because of the excellent location of the hotel, we were easily able to walk to all of the major attractions, soaking-up the atmosphere of this wonderful city. Even The Vatican was an easy stroll and we didn't have to use public transport at all during our stay. The Concordia is excellent and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic, friendly hotel in the perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: Wafter
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from six days in Rome and five nights at the Concordia. We agree with almost everyone on this site, this is a terrific hotel. Our room was air conditioned, smallish but totally practical and like the rest of the hotel immaculately clean. I cannot understand what the traveller from New Zealand was expecting when he complained about the breakfast amongst other things. On the continent it is normal to have a cold breakfast, especially as they eat quite late the night before. Anyway, the breakfast consisted of croissants, Danish pastries, bread rolls, three kinds of cereal, biscuits, rye bread, cakes, fruit, orange juice, tomato juice, yoghurts, still water, sparkling water and coffee and tea – and that’s just what I can remember. Again it was served on the immaculate terrace apart from one day when there was a spot of rain in the morning. I’m glad of that because it gave us a chance to eat in the cellar room – you must see it. We had a wonderful time in Rome and like most other people we walked everywhere and the Concordia couldn’t have been better situated. Five minutes from the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps from where you can get the Metro to the Vatican (Ottaviano) one way and to St Johns (San Giovanni) the other way. The Pantheon and Piazza Navona are 15 minutes walk away. The designer shops of Via Condotti lead off from the Spanish Steps and though we can’t afford to shop in Armani and such, there are lots of other affordable specialist shops and a great many restaurants too – seek Roberto’s recommendations. Another thing about this area is that it is very safe. There are many government buildings and embassies and there is a constant police presence. If you want a brilliant cup of coffee, carry on down the Via Condotti into the Via Borghese, past the Spanish Embassy, no sign outside but always a Carbinierri with a sub machine gun, past the little book and print market and just after the computer games shop on the left is the Café Nicosia on the right. The cappuccino is to die for. Rome is a fantastic city and you won’t do better than to stay at the Concordia.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with friends”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our party of four had a wonderful stay at the Concordia at the start of May. Everything was perfect, beginning with the hotel-arranged driver at FCO to the ultra-clean rooms and relaxing rooftop breakfast (and pre-dinner drink) looking out on St. Peter's. The location is superb--just a short walk to the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon and the Spanish Steps. The real highlight, though, was the exceptional hospitality shown by Roberto, Stefano and the rest of the staff at this cozy hotel. They run a great little hotel to the highest professional standards, but do so with a personal touch. We felt like we were leaving friends by the end of our stay. I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Rome in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff and Superb Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We returned from our stay at Hotel Concordia on May 10. My adult daughter and I could not have been happier with the hotel. We did ample research on where to stay and tried to choose a central location. Still, you never know what you are going to find. This hotel is exactly what I had been looking for. There were two metro stops within easy walking distance, the rooms and bathroom were impeccably clean and the breakfast provided was more than adequate. However, it was the staff who made the most difference in our stay. We had trouble using a calling card we had bought in the U.S. and everyone was always willing to help us. Taxis were called, bags were carried, reservations made and advise given on how to get around. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and hope I am able to come again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: redboy
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the hotel. Excellent location, friendly staff, good breakfasts, smart rooms. Rooms are smallish but very nice all the same.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jknut
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our 4 night stay at the Concordia for our first wedding anniversary. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would definately return. It was our first time in Rome and Italy, we found the hotel staff to be very helpful and their English was superb. As in previous comments, the bedroom was small, but the bathroom was fine, and how long are you in the room for anyway? The breakfast was great and eating it on the roof top terrace with fantastic views was even better! The hotel is in a great location, 2min walk to Spanish steps and not much further to the Trevi fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel having read all the reviews.Considering the central location, I was quoted a better price than the other hotels in the same area, less than 200 euro a night, most of the other 3 star hotels were asking at least 210 a night or more! The moment we arrived we knew we had made the right choice.We were warmly greeted and made to feel at home.We were more than satisfied with our room and the hotel was in full swing with plenty of guests from all over the globe.April is so busy in Rome!! We walked our feet off but loved it.We will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the roof terrace !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Came here with my girlfriend and parents for a 4 night stay and loved it.We were treated with typical Italian hospitality by the staff.The rooms were more than acceptable in terms of size and rate.They were very clean.We loved breakfast each morning overlooking the Eternal City, and there was plenty to choose from considering it was continental breakfast.We had phoned other 3 star hotels in the Spanish Steps area but we chose this because of the rate and the reviews..Good value for what we paid.The location enables you to walk to nearly all the major sights.Each evening we went to some nice trattorias ans pizzerias recommended by the front desk.In high season Rome is not cheap, accomodation wise, but when you enjoy the stay as much as we did, who cares!!

Reviews.Title: “Great "Basic" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BornTraveler
Reviews.Content: There is nothing elegant about the hotel. It is a small hotel with no major amenities and incredibly small rooms. On the other hand, the staff is wonderful, the rooms were kept incredibly clean, the location is great and it is fairly priced. While I am not sure that I would return, I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in the heart of town and only uses the hotel to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: seleus
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three days in this hotel, which is not far from the Spanish steps and is in a great location for the shops, tourist attractions and restaurants. Room was clean, great shower and very cosy. The breakfast was good with cereals, fresh bread, croissants, cheese, yoghurts and meat. Robert and Tony were great, very helpful in directions and suggestions. Left the key to our suitcase at home, but this was no problem and it got sorted immediately on arrival. We actually got to see the Sistine Chapel (we were there over the week-end the Pope was inaugurated) and it was absolutely unbelievable. Special thanks to all the staff who made this holiday very memorable. We will definately be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When visiting a foreign city you never know what to expect.Different language, customs, habits,amongst other things.Here we really felt at home.We loved the Conocrdia.They made us feel so welcome and were full of good tips on what to see and where to go.This was our first trip to Italy and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.The hotel is clean and perfectly located.The size of the room was more than acceptable.We adored the roof terrace each morning for breakfast with a view of St Peters.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful time for the whole family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I think the previous comments are all true, great staff, clean, good breakfast, excellent location and yes the rooms are a little small - there were 4 of us 2 adults and 2 children (age 9 and 6), but we managed fine.
