We came to see Rome not the inside of our hotel room!. The hotel staff were particularly good with the children - they had a wonderful time. I would definately recommend - you can pay a lot more elsewhere and get a lot less. Contact Hotel direct for the best rates.

Reviews.Title: “I would recomend this place to others”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Rome tonight after a 6 day stay. I have to say that this is a great hotel. Why the rank of 4? Well, 1) this is my first time in Rome so I have really nothing to compare to and, 2) Yes, I agree with previous reviewers about the size of the rooms and the Hotel in general. Good points? Many... 1) Good location: Via Capo Le Case is between (almost equidistant) the Trevi Fountains and Spanish Steps. You will be thankful for that, cause if you want a picture, go in the early morning (I went at 7AM). Otherwise it packs up in the Afternoon. Its right along the Metro line so its a short distance to a subway station. Plus, for the people who like shopping its close to the downtown area with the many trendy European clothing shops. 2) Clean, well run hotel. The staff is helpful and friendly and will help you out with information, directions, getting a cab, etc. They even helped me get a decent bottle of Grappa. 3) Decent breakfast. I usually expect a continental breakfast to be a scone and coffee. Their spread, granted not homemade, was rather good. I dont eat too much so I didnt try everything they have. 4) I got it at a good price. I dont know what was the occasion, but I got it for around E 175/night. Compared to other 3-star hotels and for what I got in service and convenience it was well worth it. For the cons (meaning the small room and small bathroom), I never had a problem with it. Most of my time is spent walking around Rome and eating. Im only there for sleeping, to freshen up, and to drop off stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been to Rome before and this hotel is by far the cleanest and friendliest I have stayed at.The rooms are so clean and kept in good order.The location is perfect, between Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain.The men on the front desk are so polite and English speaking. The breakfast was very good by European standards. The Hotel Concordia helped to make our stay in this extremely caotic city more peaceful and homely. We will be back in the future for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Concordia: as good as they say”
Reviews.Author: AlistairChester
Reviews.Content: The Concordia Hotel lived up to its reputation: very clean, comfortable, well situated and with extremely helpful staff. Take their advice on transport and where to eat; La Rampa and the Leonardo bar in the nearby Piazza Mignanelli are to be recommended. Avoid the Pizzeria opposite the Concordia; we were overcharged.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at this lovely small hotel, cleaning standards were very high and the continental breakfast was more than adequate, the only thing I could criticise was the size of the room we stayed, was not large but anyhow between medium European size for a three star hotels and it was well decorated. We were very impressed with the friendly welcome and assistance of the front desk staff, we used their limo service from the airport (€40 fixed price) for two adults. Spanish steps and the Trevi fountain is a few minutes away, Great location.

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: gerryg
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Concordia and were very happy. The room was very clean, comfortable, and the hotel is close to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. The staff was also very friendly and helpful. We chose this hotel based on recommendations in trip advisor, and were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: pjc115
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of our trip and it was the smallest room we had of the four hotels in Italy. Our room was on the fifth floor which was fine but the elevator only went to the 4th floor so we had to walk up a floor to our room. Also had to walk up one level from the lobby to get the elevator. This was a hassle bringing up our luggage and the elevator could only fit 2 people without luggage. Our room which was clean but very small, no where to put our luggage. We put it in a small closet right next to the bed which was a problem to get clothes out of the suitcase. The shower had good water pressure but was very tight forget about bending down not enough room. Positive points - Good location, helpful English speaking staff, decent breakfast in a nice room, good price on room and set up a return trip to the airport with a limo service at a reasonable price. All in all it was a decent place at a good price. If you could get past the size of the room then I would suggest it but if you are claustrophobic then don't consider this hotel. I just feel that previous reviews may have been submitted by the hotel itself because although it was a decent place it was far from excellent. And definately don't believe it deserves to be ranked number 4 in all of the Rome hotels. If this ranking is legit I would hate to see the 30 th ranked hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay in the Concordia Hotel. It was scrupulously clean, the continental breakfast was excellent. The staff were most helpful and pleasant - nothing was too much trouble. The location was ideally situated for transport and within walking distance of the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. We would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EnglandTeresa
Reviews.Content: This is a super little hotel. The rooms are beautiful and the management are extremeluy helpful and welcoming. It is ideally situated to see all the major attractions, all are within walking distance. However a word of warning if you intend to take a taxi from the airport ring the hotel to organise this. We didn;t. we got our own taxi and they ripped us off. We will definitely return to Rome and will definitely stay at this hotel again. Enjoy Rome, we certainly did.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Hotel Concordia with my wife and two teenage sons.It was our first trip to Italy and the experience was a success.This hotel we found thanks to Trip Avisor.The hotel is run in a friendly and relaxing way, because it is family owned and managed. and very clean. We were able to see the city with ease thanks to the strategically central location.I was able to use internet at any time at no extra charge.All in all nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay! Very conveniently located, great prices, extremely kind and helpful employees, delicious breakfast, Small room that was clean and quiet. . The Hotel is located in a neighborhood where you find the major Museums, shops and restaurants. You are within walking distance to the Spanish steps, a good location at a very good value. I will certainley stay at the Concordia again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Superb family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kevin C
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to the excellent reports from Tripadvisor members. We were not disappointed. The situation is excellent - every major attraction is within walking distance (eg Colosseum 30 min max). If you cannot manage to walk for 30 minutes in the Rome heat the Barberini metro stop is just 2 minutes away and a bus terminus likewise 2 minutes away. The no. 85 bus takes 10 minutes to get to the Colosseum. All directions and instructions for transport were provided by Mr Roberto or his staff. Recommendations for restaurants with approximate prices were also accurate. The hotel itself was everything that has been mentioned previously. The bedrooms are standard European size and the European breakfast was more than adequate. I never did find out why the bed was the comfiest I have ever slept in and that includes my own! The rooms are not only spotless but they are very homely. Indeed the whole hotel gives the impression of staying at a friend's house rather than a hotel. This includes security. All of the staff have worked at the hotel for many years and Mr Roberto does not use agency staff - unlike other well known hotels in Rome! My two boys stayed in a twin room on a separate floor and felt secure at all times. We were all sad to leave the hotel as much as we were sad to leave Rome. As a final gesture the taxi to the airport, arranged by the hotel, was cheaper than anything else advertised. We shall return!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: TeacherMan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Concordia for 6 nights beginning on Good Friday. The location was excellent; close enough to walk to most of the major sights and also close to the subway stop and bus routes. The room was small compared to American hotels, but probably standard compared to European. The room and hotel were very clean and the staff was friendly and accomodating. I contacted the hotel via e-mail and they arranged for a car to meet us at the airport. They also arranged for our return to the airport and the rates were less than I was quoted by limo services whom I had also contacted. Breakfast was served in a nice room. It was a standard continental breakfast; sweet rolls, yoguart, cereals, coffee,etc. It was more than adequate to begin the day. This was our first trip to Rome. I chose the Concordia based on reviews on this site. I was very pleased with my choice and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I came to this hotel, also, thanks to the reviews on Tripadvisor. The comments corresponded to our experiences at this hotel.The rooms are clean, comfortable and just a little bit on the small side.This is not such a burden because the space is used with intelligence, everything you need is found.Satellite tv, mini-bar,safety box,and a spacious and cheerful en-suite bathroom.The colors are pastel and bright.We were given a key to the safe at no extra charge.The staff was so attentive and friendly.The breakfast was continental and acceptable.What made this place so special was the family atmosphere and the clean ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I liked my stay at Concordia, the hotel is very clean nicely decorated, and reasonably priced, the breakfast is excellent and can be rated higher for a three star Hotel than most other hotels that I have stayed in Europe . Reception staff are gentle and kind, they offer good information on the city, especially for restaurants places of interest. Good location, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but small”
Reviews.Author: eulb76
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed in this hotel at the end of our trip to Italy in March 2005. The location of this hotel is great - just a few minutes from the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain, and a very nice shopping area. Also, the staff of the Hotel Concordia is great - very friendly and helpful. However, the breakfast was probably the most mediocre breakfast that we had during our entire trip (we skipped breakfast after trying it once), and our room was really small. Having a small room at the end of a long trip is not a great idea if you are likely to need to rest and spend more time in your room than usual. Overall, I consider this hotel to be okay - the high-quality staff and the location contribute significantly to my rating.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than I had hoped!”
Reviews.Author: Mikegrif
Reviews.Content: My best hotel experience outside the Peninsula in Chicago ... even better than I expected. The staff is friendly and superb, and the rooms are beautiful. The other reviews had set a rather high standard, but my wife and I loved it and were almost as sad leaving the hotel as we were leaving Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I chose the Concordia thanks to Tripadvisor and enjoyed the stay very much thanks to a number of reasons.First of all it is a family run hotel and this shows in the way the clients are treated with warmth by the owner Mr Roberto and his staff.He is very talkative and gives useful tips on where to go and what to see.He is very knowledgable on Roman history. The location is fantastic, you can just walk to most places from here. Spanish Steps, Trevi, Navona,and the rest. For restaurants you will be spoilt for choice !! We found a very useful supermarket two blocks down with the "correct" prices. The room was a bit on the small side, but cheerfully decorated and extremely clean.The en-suite bathroom is spacious and so immaculate. Having been here in early March would love to come back in the warmer months. Breakfast was continental and abundant. A nice stay and a great 5 days in Rome

Reviews.Title: “excellent base for Rome sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: dr&sa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this lovely hotel from 21 to 26 March 2005. We totally endorse all the previous positive comments about this hotel. The location is excellent, within walking distance of all the major sights. The staff are friendly and very helpful and our room was well equipped and absolutely spotless. Care is taken to make your stay enjoyable and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “What a little gem”
Reviews.Author: Kilpedder
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful four days in Rome. Before we left we read the reviews on the Concordia Hotel and they were very helpful.This hotel is a little gem! it is great value for money.It's location is fantastic! it is so central and near to everything, Spanish Steps,Pantheon, Trevi,Colesseum,and SHOPPING!! The shopping is fantastic,such a selection to suit all tastes.Our 18 Yr old son and twenty yr old daughter had a ball buying at the shops as there is a great selection of shops to suit every pocket.We only needed to get a taxi twice and that was from the Termini Station to our hotel when arrived on the train from the airport and going back to Termini to get the train to the airport.It's so easy to take the train into Termini Station in Rome from the Airport ,10 euro. The staff in the Concordia are very polite and helpful, Before we went we knew that the rooms would be small so it didn't bother us much.The rooms are nicely decorated and very clean, the bathroom was spotless and has a hairdrier. the mini bar was great value only 1 euro for minerals.The breakfast was good, crossaints,cereal, nice coffee and served in a quaint room.I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Concordia Hotel, Go on try it you will be surprised!!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite”
Reviews.Author: Karyn512
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Concordia for 5 nights in February and this was by far our favorite hotel. As many people have said, the location was perfect, the breakfast was great, and the room was clean. What made our stay so special was Roberto and his great staff. We felt like we were staying with family! We were sad to leave not only a great city but a great new friend. We'll be back to stay - maybe for the next big birthday!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: ROAMERS2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and wish it could have been longer. The location is superb and very close to the major tourist spots. the metro is very close by, very cheap (1 Euro covers the whole network!) and easy to use. The hotel is very traditional and perfect for our romantic break! Although the rooms are small, we were very impressed by the standard of cleanliness, decor and amenities. Breakfast was delicious and very well presented with great service. Sadly the roof garden was not opening until Easter week. Best of all was the courtesy, helpfulness and friendliness of the owner and his staff. They had a real interest in the guests and went out of their way to make us feel at home. Advice on restaurants, travel and even the Pope's state of health all willingly given! When next in Rome we will definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I trawled the net trying to find a suitable hotel in Rome and found 'Trip Advisor' where Hotel Concordia was highly recommended. My main criteria being good location, cleanliness and reasonably priced. I got all three at the Concordia. Yes, the rooms are really small but they are immaculately clean so that compensates. Breakfast is basic but fresh and adequate with friendly service. The hotel is 5 minutes from both the Piazza di Spagna and the Fontana di Trevi and other main streets leading to the historic sights...couldn't be placed more centrally. Ask the hotelier to recommend the lovely restaurant just 5 minutes away (the name escapes me)! The streets are really noisy in central Rome and sleep was a little disturbed but compared to other hotels situated in busier areas the Concordia is a bit quieter. At 520 Euros for 4 nights in a double room I found it to be excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Ritorna Roma”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have been guests of Hotel Concordia about 5 times, and have no desires to look for alternate accommodations when in Rome. This hotel is expertly managed, very clean, exceptionally well located, and very competitively priced. It is a family run business, giving special attention to pleasing guests with personal greetings and making them feel comfortable in an "at home" atmosphere. The hotel is within easy walking distance of historical sites, art and culture, parks, and shopping. Terrific food is always easily found, and we always feel welcomed, almost as family, not only as guests. Carl and Martha Giordano

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay there again!!!”
Reviews.Author: pkfeld
Reviews.Content: The Concordia was perfectly located, very clean, great breakfast with a well informed and friendly staff. The room is for sleeping only as it is sooo small. But we were hardly there so it didn't really matter. It is a great value but don't expect much charm.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong with this.”
Reviews.Author: vsleepy
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome late January, 2005. Friendly staff at Concordial gave us a free upgrade from triple to two rooms. Thank you! The hotel is only 3 mins walk from the Spanish Steps and Metro (next to the steps). We even managed to visited 9 different major tourist attractions on foot in one day due to its location. The room was very clean, and had everything we need. The breakfast was especially great, and we did not have better breakfast anywhere else. Oh, the main shopping area is in front of the Spanish Steps, and it is the safer area of Rome. This hotel made visiting Rome, shopping, and travelling EASY! We will be back !

Reviews.Title: “A real gem in the heart of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Vanilla
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a fabulous 4 days in Rome and could not recommend a better place to stay! Having checked out numerous hotels in the centre of Rome to compare price/location/reviews etc… we settled on the Concordia due to all the impressive feedback on TripAdvisor and we were not disappointed. The hotel is located on a quiet side street within walking distance of all the sights – we chose to walk everywhere as we wanted to explore as much of the centre of Rome as possible! Our longest walk was across to the Vatican & St. Peter’s – only a 30 minute stroll. Our room was extremely clean with adequate hanging/storage space for clothes, TV, mini bar, plug points etc…and a very comfy bed. The bathroom was compact but contained all the essentials. We were impressed with the kindness and level of service displayed by all the staff to guarantee a perfect stay – a real gem in the heart of Rome! P.S. Rome is currently experiencing a very cold winter so be prepared!! We experienced a very cold spell with lots of rain and only a little sunshine!

Reviews.Title: “Atmospheric and clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We (three people) spent three nights at the Concordia and enjoyed our stay very much. The hotel is atmospheric and clean, the rooms are small but the spacious enough and nice and the bathrooms are all newly refurbished, as the hotel in general is. They are all extremely welcoming and helpful. The breakfast is served in a lovely room. Italian breakfast: Coffee, Cappuccinos, tea, croissant or cake, rolls, fruits, juice, all varying from day to day. We will definitely revisit Rome and will stay at the Hotel Concordia again. They made our short holiday very special.

Reviews.Title: “I would absolutely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff that runs this hotel is wonderful . I felt as if I were visiting friends who wanted to ensure that my trip was perfect. Location was great, and the hotel was lovely, small rooms - very clean. They gave excellent restaurant recommendations and made reservations for me at the galleria Borghese I wanted to visit. I would absolutely stay here again!
